Reviews.Title: “We love it!!”
Reviews.Author: luvroma2
Reviews.Content: This is a 1600's canal house, with sloping floors, retro-fitted bathrooms and an erratic elevator but we love it. This type of place is not for everyone, but it is clean, convenient, atmospheric and has wonderful views of the canals. There are 9 rooms and they are generally booked well in advance. Free WiFi is available, but it does not work in the upper floors. There is a computer on the ground floor for general use which is available from 8 am - 8 pm. The breakfasts are tasty and substantial - although I wish they were offered earlier (8:30 - 10:30) - my only complaint. We are early risers and like to start our day before 8:30, therefore, we frequently cannot have breakfast. Cash only (euros) - no crerdit cards.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you're not too picky”
Reviews.Author: LilyStarInterlaken
Reviews.Content: The location is good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean. It was quiet at night. The breakfast was an odd combination of stuff but we liked it. Good quality bread and cheese -- delicious. We were on the "third floor" but that was equivalent to the sixth floor in the USA - - at least we walked up six flights of stairs to get there. The elevator was not working while we were there. The room had a nice view but there were some weird things. When you turned on the hot water, you got good pressure for about five seconds and then it went down to a drizzle. You could manipulate it to make it work but it made the shower a bit of a challenge. The shower was odd too. It was just a little depression in the floor and it was hard to contain the water within it. There was no hair dryer in the room. They might have had one at the front desk but that would involve walking down six flights of stairs to get it and walking back up again to dry my hair. I just didn't wash it for three days since letting it dry naturally was not an option - - too cold outside. Although there was ample space for them, there were no towel bars in the bathroom. What do you do with your wet towel? While we were watching staff set the tables in the breakfast room, he dropped a clean spoon on the floor and then proceeded to pick it up and set it at the clean place setting. Makes me wonder what happened to my silverware or food for that matter. We probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Fox_and_Anchor
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I think I set my hopes too high for this place. I've stayed in better budget hotels in Amsterdam than Hotel Brouwer. While I can imagine the challenges of maintaining a historic structure (while still managing to run a successful business), it felt much more neglected than I anticipated for a budget accommodation. The two best things about staying here: 1. The location: an easy walk from the central train station (5-7 minutes) and in the beautiful, historic Jordaan neighborhood. Easy walking to cafes, tulip market, the canals, and main sights. 2. The breakfast: hot croissants, soft boiled egg, English muffin, and your own pot of french press coffee. However, the breakfast room could use a good, deep clean. What wasn't so great: 1. Beds - uncomfortable 2. Shower - entire bathroom floor flooded while showering. Do not put anything on the floor. 3. Window coverings - the view of the canal was wonderful. However, only two of the four windows had coverings. You'll be waking up with the sun whether you like it or not!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay, reasonably priced and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Karslima
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brouwer for one night and overall had a good stay. This hotel is very close to Amsterdam Centraal, the Jordan neighborhood and red light district. This area can get very noisy but we didnt hear it from our room. The room, called Breitner, had a lovely canal view. It was also very clean. I did not like the way the shower and the toilet were laid out but everything worked in there - it just had one of those showers where you had to be careful or else you'll have water all over the bathroom. We didn't really mind this too much but like most traditional Amsterdam canal homes the stair case is very steep. They have a very narrow elevator that can fit one person and a luggage but not anything else - definitely something to consider if you're not able to climb those stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Decent central budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Seahorse
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely terraced building on an elegant canal road. My room had great views of canals and a laminate floor with a pleasing gradient. Thee was a little urban car and scooter noise at night, and the sound insultation from other rooms wasn't great, though not enough to bother me. 'Budget' would be a fairer description of Hotel Brouwer than 'generous'. The room was adequate, rather than enchanting: details betray the owner's awareness of his profit margin. The reception/breakfast room is attractrively Bohemian. The website omits mention of the 5% tourist tax that's added to the quoted prices. It's a small place run by a small staff. Don't expect a 24-hour service, or to pay with plastic. When I arrived late (as agreed) the night guy answered the door grumpily: the message hadn't reached him. To be fair, he softened in the face of relentless charm. Breakfast doesn't start until 8.30 am, which will frustrate some. But the manager went some way out of his way to ensure I didn't leave hungry when I had to set off before then for a morning flight. And their simple breakfast is more than adequate. The speed of the wifi internet fluctuates eerily; you wouldn't want to rely on it. You could do a lot worse. It felt a little pricey for its standard. But it was full up, so this may just be Amsterdam prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and convenient for the money you spend”
Reviews.Author: cl_loertscher
Reviews.Content: Housed in a XVIth century typical Amsterdam bourgeois building, this hotel does not perhaps fit all the classical international standards, but it has a warm atmosphere, good service on the whole and is perfectly located on a canal, in a quiet place and less than 10-minutes walk from the central railroad station. For 95â‚¬ per night for a double, who could ask for more ?

Reviews.Title: “My Stay @ Hotel Brouwer”
Reviews.Author: Yungmarie
Reviews.Content: I must say that it was most convenient. Close to almost everything and especially Centraal Station and all the canal boats. Literally a 3-5 min walk. I was very comfortable there and I stayed in the "Mesdag" Room. It was located on the 2nd floor. It had a beautiful view looking out on the canal and as far as your eye could see. It was very cold there and all the canals were pretty much frozen. Breakfast was served from 8am-10am (or 10:30) They pretty much had the same thing each morning and you could know when it was breakfast time, as the entire hotel was intoxicating with the baked items, which consisted of freshly made croissants, something like an English muffin and another like a whole wheat sour dough. With 2 slices of cheese, some butter & jelly and a boiled egg if you liked. Small glass of OJ and coffee or tea. It was delish. I think I ate there about 3 mornings out of the week that I stayed there. They had recommended a few places to eat as well which were also in walking distance. My room had it's own bathroom and it was a single room, but quite cozy :-) The lighting in the bathroom was not great so I was constantly using the light from the bedroom and they had a full length mirror on the back of the bathroom door, so applying make up and dressing was made much easier. Oh the walls are paper thin, so be careful what you do and say :-) You could also use their computer from 8am-8pm which is found in a small area off the dining/lobby area. Their internet access was very, very slow. I used it a couple of times. Wi-fi is also accessible there as well. The managers were quite friendly and very helpful. I settled my bill the night before my leaving as it was an early morning flight, so all I did was leave the key in the room. They also have a lift, just in case u were worried about lugging bags up 3 flight of stairs. It can only take 1 person at a time. It's really small. The only bad experience I had and I don't think it was quite their fault but I was told that they used a particular driver for airport/taxi runs and was told that one would be there by 6:30am and I should be outdoors by no later than 6:20am. I did just that and waited and waited and waited and ......it wasn't until 7am when I saw a light on in the lobby and went and tapped on the window and the gentleman was kind enough to open the door so I could tell him what I wanted. He checked something on the desk and told me that he didnt see anything about a call for a cab. In any event he called one and they finally came about 7:20am. My flight was leaving at 9 and I wasn't sure what check in was going to be like and or security check. By the time I got to the gate was approx 8:40 (Thank goodness) :-) But everything else was perfect. I didn;t need much from them and when I did, they were quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: WillemDekorte
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the Hotel Brouwer, myself and my girlfriend are just back from there. We had the Escher room and it was so nice, with excellent views. The breakfast was gorgeous, eggs, cheese, muffins, coffee, OJ and croissants, so simple! Thanks so much to everyone, and special mentions goes to the two dogs Gentle and Chewy :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice room, but do not upset the night watchman.”
Reviews.Author: Mare123Portland
Reviews.Content: We liked this place a lot even though the night watchman was very very upset we arrived 15 minutes late, despite our getting permission to do so by the owner. We almost weren't allowed to check in at all even though we were polite, accommodating, etc. Fortunately, the rest of the staff were very apologetic and attentive, and the breakfast was very nice. We will stay here again, and will steer clear of Ramon.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant, Convenient, Reasonable Amsterdam B&B”
Reviews.Author: Wyvernoodle
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights October 2011 and it was lovely. Had the Van Gogh room overlooking the Singel canal. Large double, very nice en suite facilities, pleasant folks. Good breakfast. 10-15 minute walk from Centraal Station, tram line one block east, so one can get everywhere. Just on the edge of Jordaan.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brouwer”
Reviews.Author: Judy Q
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in December 2011. The owner is friendly and the breakfast is good. Its located with in walking distance of the Anne Frank Home, the train station and the Pancake Bakery. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. The hotel is an older hotel and the building has a lot of character. If your looking for the Hilton this is not it. If you want a great location with friendly people and a building with some real history this is the place to go. We had a great time. The hotel offered some great directions and good advice. The bed was comfy and warm. Great Location. Owner is very nice, and friendly. Continental breakfast was yummy :) We stayed in the corner room called the Rembrant Room.

Reviews.Title: “No luxury, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCat
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from Tripadvisor and made the reservation by email. The price was low and location good. Stayed two nights in Vermeer room. The hotel is located on the Singel canal and it was easy to find. The staff spoke excellent English and were helpful. Our room was ready when we arrived at 11 am. The best thing about our room was the view. Bad parts were the shower, noise from the street and noise from the radiators. I couldn't have slept without earplugs. Room was pretty basic and nothing fancy. There's not much closet space or anything where to unpack your belongings. No safe, small tv, comfy bed and small table and couple of chairs. The house is old and charming with wooden floors but the room was a bit boring and I have to say I'm not used to luxury or anything fancy. Breakfast was included with the price and it was tasty. They serve it and there were coffee/tea, fresh bread, cheese and juice. On some days there were two dogs on the reception area and they were very cute. The stairs are steep and there's also a small elevator. They don't take credit cards so be prepared to pay with cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: elma21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Brouwer beginning of October Great location on the Singel Canal where we could walk to most attractions. Room was large, very clean with lots of windows and a great view. The small elevator made getting our luggage up those Dutch canal house spiral steps easy. Helpful English speaking staff. Reasonably priced - less than 100euros including a nice breakfast. Computer is available to print our boarding pass. http://www.hotelbrouwer.nl/

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in the canal district, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Tralika
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of three nights at the Hotel Brouwer during two visits while passing through Amsterdam and had a great time. The building is a converted canal home built in the 16th century. As with most of these old buildings in Amsterdam it has very steep stairs but it also has an elevator. Both of the rooms we stayed in overlooked the Singel canal and had postcard views, the best views were from the top floor room, no surprise there. The rooms were clean with two twin beds side by side to make a double bed, sort of. Bathrooms were were also clean and functional, one of the rooms had a tub and shower, the other just a shower. Our hosts were gracious and allowed us to check in early on both of our arrivals in Amsterdam from overnight flights. Breakfast was also good, coffee great! A computer is available to check email, etc. There was some street noise at night. Not bad on the weeknights but more on the one Friday night we stayed there. I think the street noise will be a problem anywhere in the canal district. If this is a big problem for you then staying at the Hilton may be a good idea. For me it was part of the local color. I would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Brouwer again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.....For Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: shakespiers
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Vermeer room for 4 nights, leaving yesterday. The room was clean and basic with fabulous views out to the Singel. The bathroom was fine. I didn't need much more as we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel apart from sleeping. Breakfast was superb. Eggs were cooked from scratch when you showed up at the table, so no dark ring round the yolk. Good coffee, freshly brewed in a cafetiere. You also get a good mature gouda, a baguette and a crumpet. The location is excellent. Near all the sights, bars and restaurants and right next to the Jordaan. I paid â‚¬100 for a twin but this was almost half the price of some 2 and 3 star accommodation nearby. I'm still completely flabbergasted as to why Amsterdam is the most expensive city in Europe for tourist accommodation. It wasn't always as prohibitively priced. If you're looking for no frills accommodation that is almost good value then you could do a lot worse than stay at the Brouwer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaAdventuress
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Brouwer in August 2011. Our experience was amazing! The rooms were spotless and lovely. The breakfast was delightful, cheese, jam, eggs, assortment of bread, coffee/tea and orange juice. Staff and owners were helpful and kind. The price was amazing, especially when compared to other B&B's. Hotel Brouwer was not top luxury but it is comfortable, historic and centrally placed to all tourist areas. When we return to Amsterdam, we will absolutely stay here and nowhere else. A few notes for those who are new to Amsterdam. Yes, Hotel Brouwer is located next door and near a few sex work residences (red light) but don't worry, the ladies won't bite and were quite sweet. Though located on the corner of the Singel canal, we found it quiet at night except for the Tuesday AM trash pick up.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: jandn
Reviews.Content: While I would agree that the location of this hotel is good, travellers should be aware that this is a one-star hotel. We were unaware of this when we booked it and the room tells the story. We were booked in the Vermeer room and I imagine that other than the bathroom, nothing in the room has changed since Vermeer was alive. It is small, there is no comfortable place to sit, only a desk chair. Oh yes, there is a tiny TV. On the plus side, the staff is very helpful and the facility is clean and there is free internet. There are about 4 red lights on the block, one next door but that really didn't bother us although it may offend some. It is located on a busy street and is quite noisy during sleeping hours. We did find a good restaurant with excellent food and very reasonable prices that is very close to the hotel called Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lani K
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Brouwer. The staff was excellent, all English speaking. Excellent location, easy walking distance from Amsterdam Central train station. Close to several street car lines. Our only issue was noise from the street overnight, cars and people talking. Otherwise, a lovely stay, and we would stay there again if we're back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a lovely setting on Singel canal”
Reviews.Author: ZoeBristol
Reviews.Content: I was not disappointed on my return to this delightful hotel in a 17th century canal house. The accommodation is simple but spotlessly clean.Towels changed and rooms cleaned daily. Breakfast ...an assortment of breads, boiled egg, cheese and jam and served in the reception area overlooking the canal.It is excellent value for money, especially as the rooms have en suite facilities. Importantly it is situated away from the garish and somewhat tacky delights of the more touristy areas around the Central Station and the red light district. A great choice if you want to get a feel of historical Amsterdam and avoid a corporate hotel, or some kind of back - packing experience in one of the cheaper hotels. This hotel is smoke free. Perhaps not for anybody with mobility problems as the stairs are quite tricky and the lift a rather cramped, clunky one person experience. It appears to be a family run business and the hoteliers and the staff give excellent advice about local restaurants, tram routes etc.They can also arrange a taxi to the airport at a very reasonable price. Good choice if you don't want lots of frills.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brouwer Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Dennis L
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Amsterdam and third stay at the Hotel Brouwer. We originally stayed here based on Trip Advisor reviews and have not been disappointed. If you want a true Amsterdam experience this is the place to stay. Rooms are very simply appointed (very similar looking to Van Gogh's "The Bedroom"), very clean and comfortable. Fantastic location, and easy walk from City Center train and near the Jordaan. Lovely setting on corner of two canals. Staff are very friendly and prepare a lovely, simple Dutch breakfast of croissants and jam, boiled egg and cheese, with great coffee and conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: SaleDamc
Reviews.Content: I got back yesterday, from a 3 night stay at the Brouwer and I was very impressed. Situated in a very pleasant area, only 10 minutes walk from Centraal Station and over looking one of the many canals, it is a charming little place with a very homely feel to it. My single room (Mesdag) was small but perfect for my needs and had a great view over the canal. The room was clean, as was the bathroom and the linen was changed on a daily basis. There is not a great deal of storage space but again, just enough for a solo traveller. There was a writing desk, a bed side cabinet, complete with lamp and clock and there was TV with a couple of English language channels. The breakfast was good and you were given a warm crumpet, croissant and bread roll, with butter and jam. Coffee and orange juice were also provided.The owners were extremely hospitable and always had time for a chat or to give some advice about ther city. In a city where decent accommodation seems to come at a price, at 60 euros a night, the Hotel Brouwer respresents very good value for money. I really liked Amsterdam and will definitely be going back and the Brouwer will certainly be the first place I check for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Best area in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Robyn F
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel, it was in the nicest part of Amsterdam and very central to everything. The roomms were very clean and the owners very friendly. They were nice enough to look after our bags before check in time but be aware that if you have very large bags, the stairwell is very small and the lift is for one person only. Breakfast is only served from 8.30am so we weren't able to have breakfast as our schedules meant we had to leave early. Would definitely recommend this place for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Otto1347
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great location, walking distance from Central Station along the Singel, great view from rooms. Rooms are small, clean and reasonably priced, less than 100euros. Breakfast not great, rolls, cheese, hard boiled eggs, juice and coffee. NO CREDIT CARDS, cash only! They speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous atmosphere, fun to stay there”
Reviews.Author: medelasck
Reviews.Content: Great location in central Amsterdam, 10 minutes from the train station, the Brouwer combines an Old World feeling with the comforts necessary to make it a very pleasant stay. We enjoyed the room - clean, overlooking the picturesque Singel Canal - the satisfying Continental breakfast, and the warm attention of owner and Argentine staff. The free WiFi worked great. The Brouwer made our stay in Amsterdam unforgettable. .

Reviews.Title: “Well located welcoming and quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryteresa
Reviews.Content: A few minutes walk from the train station and well located for all attractions. The hotel has 8 rooms each named after one of the famous artists. We stayed in the Van Gogh which overlooked the Singel canal and was very comfortable. A very nicely served breakfast with a large pot of fresh coffee is included in the price. I would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: travelmeisteren
Reviews.Content: This was our, I don't remember how many times, stay at Hotel Brouwer. We've been there 12-15 times probably. This time we were in the Mondriaan room on the 3rd (top) floor for 3 nights. The hotel is in a wonderful location right on the Singel canal. The staff are super friendly. The room is large with a large bathroom as well. We had a few minor inconveniences this time (trash not emptied, foot towel for shower not replaced, toilet paper left empty) but these weren't enough to annoy us. We were able to get the TP replaced via reception (the others were minor enough). Breakfast is great with lots of bread, cheese, preserves, and a hard boiled egg if so desired. They've got a free Internet computer to use in the lobby and employees are quite knowledgeable about the city and it sites and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and noisy, but in right in the center”
Reviews.Author: Tomas50
Reviews.Content: Hotel Brouwer seems to be overrated. ItÂ´s alright but not that good. I stayed 3 nights in June in the single room called Hals ItÂ´s right in the center of AÂ´dam, near to shopping and nightlife.ThatÂ´s the best. But itÂ´s very noisy all night long and the windows are thin. The room was very small and the floor had settled at the corner, in fact I fell out of bed due to this the first night. The breakfast is simple IÂ´ll remeber it but I wouldnÂ´t stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but great”
Reviews.Author: beno77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simple but for the price excellent... A real hidden gem.. Great location and price includes a very simple but nice breakfast. Staff are very helpful and price also includes free WiFi.. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: andychem18
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, only a short walk from the railway station which means that you donâ€™t have to drag cases on and off buses or trams, also it is very easy to find as its right on the Singel canal. The hotel is only small but that is one of its many charms, with only 8 rooms you feel that you are staying with a family rather than in a faceless concrete monster. Our room was the Rembrandt room which is on the corner of the building giving views across and along the Singel canal. The breakfast was lovely and again felt more like home cooking than normal hotel blandness. The owners were very welcoming and would spend time talking to you and offering advice without it seeming false. I would recommend this hotel for a great stay in Amsterdam but as others have said take cash as credit cards are not accepted. Also to book contact the hotel directly as I could not find them on any booking site.

Reviews.Title: “Really good spot”
Reviews.Author: tacalg1986
Reviews.Content: Love this place all around. Great rates, great location, nice staff, very clean, excellent views. Loved it I tired to book again 6 months in advance and they were already full. Just go awesome place!

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: BGIWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: After a week of searching online, I discovered this little gem nestled along the Singel canal. Itâ€™s very affordable, just 60â‚¬ + 5% tourist tax a night including breakfast for a single room. When I arrived, I was given a double room at the same rate which was a plus. I had an impressive view of the canal as well. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Service at this small hotel was personalised, warm and friendly. Just what you need, unlike one of those big chains like Ibis. Each of the rooms is named after a famous Dutch artist, mines was Van Gogh! The breakfast was more than adequate, a warm mini baguette, a croissant and a Dutch pancake. There was also a warm hard-boiled egg, jam/butter and coffee/tea/juice. Although there is no restaurant, breakfast is served in the reception area. It's more than adequate. The manager was very helpful in giving advice and tips on things to see and do in the city. The location was a short 10 minute walk from the Centraal Station, which provides frequent rail links to Schiphol for 3.70â‚¬ one-way, 4.20â‚¬ if you use the ticket counter. There is also a free computer and printer for guest use in the lobby and free Wi-Fi throughout the property. If youâ€™re a single or a couple looking for a great place to stay at an affordable rate, Hotel Brouwer is it! Just one thing to note, they do NOT accept any credit cards, payment by cash only. Most definitely I shall return there on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful canal side location in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: TLAOrangeville
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this locale...2010 AND 2005. Reasonable mid-priced hotel in Amsterdam - cental...on the Singel canal...you can pretty much walk to everywhere and the Train Station is only a short walk away. Double Room this time - very cozy with ensuite, view of canal & street. Easy to heat in chilly December and nice table with chairs for take-away meals. Breakfast included....egg, bread, bread, bread, jam, coffee and juice. Nice staff...a little standoffish but certainly kind and helpful. Info. area, books to borrow about the locale and free internet (but use reasonably when required by other guests). If we ever stay here again, we would continue to book at this place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “great location, ambiance, & had an elevator !”
Reviews.Author: netherholt
Reviews.Content: Granted, it was a tiny elevator, but at least it made getting the luggage up those Dutch canal home steps easy ! Great location to the Central Station, coffee houses, public transportation, and RIGHT on a canal. Want to return to Amsterdam for a 3 wk stay, but it might be out of our price range for that period of time. Otherwise, would definitely suggest this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Staff, Noisy Location”
Reviews.Author: travelcityguy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Brouwer was good. It is a well preserved hotel and in our room one got a running start to get into bed from either the windows are the bathroom, as the floor has settled in the center of the room. The staff (Joeseph, Ellen and everyone) was wonderful, very helpful, and interesting to talk to and interact with. They are extremely helpful! The hotel has alot of foot/bar/pedestrian/bar traffic all night long (it is Amsterdam after all). While the hotel is not responsible for the traffic, it is responsible for the "thin" windows. Overall, I would stay at the hotel again, with the realization that I would need to stay off the beautiful canal views.

Reviews.Title: “Small, authentic, well-located”
Reviews.Author: MPJ515
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam (but it won't be our last) and, when we return, we'll return to the Hotel Brouwer, as well. This hotel is small, simple and clean but the charm lies in the 1652 building, with it's blue tiles, slanting floors and canal views. It sits on the Singel canal and is within easy walking distance to the train station, old town centre, Anne Frank Haus, lots of restaurants and shopping. A few things to note about the hotel: They only take cash, which was not evident (to me) on the web site. If you need a hair dryer, ask at the front desk, it won't be in your room. Only one pillow per person (per bed), but you can ask for more. The beds are comfortable, there's a computer in a common area for free use, the staff is SO nice (actually, everyone in Amsterdam was friendly and kind) and the breakfast (included) is very good, if simple: soft-boiled egg, basket of warm croissants, crumpets, hard rolls and butter, cheese and jams. Coffee or tea. By the way, about 2 doors down is a little English resto called Greenwood that has great Eggs Benedict!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place, but I don't think I would go back.”
Reviews.Author: kbrinker
Reviews.Content: Hotel Brouwer has a lot of great things about it: it is close enough to the city center to see and do many things, has beautiful canal views, the staff speak many languages and can help you make reservations, call taxis, or give you some good ideas about things to see off the touristy track. There is also a tiny lift to bring your suitcases up and down. Breakfast is simple - bread, bread, and bread... and an egg, a slice of cheese, and coffee/tea. The hotel is in a beautiful and funky 17th century building, but with that comes some problems: the walls inside are not insulated, so you will hear your neighbors talking, listening to music... not to mention all of the street noise outside which kept me up late at night. The whole building is beautiful and well cared for, but the windows are old and not insulated so you will hear bikes, people talking on the street, etc, even on the top floor. My bed wasn't in a frame so it would slip of the box-spring whenever I would get out of bed, and it was also old and too soft in the middle to give any support. I think the Hotel Brouwer is very nice, but I don't think I will be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: kel3120
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in early September. It was a very easy walk from central station and very easy to find along Singel canal. We arrived early on a Sunday morning and dropped off our bags. We had the Van Gogh room. Your two options are a spiral staircase or small elevator. We only had one bag each so it wasn't a problem. The rooms are nice size and clean. The bathroom was s decent size for european standards. We did have a hairdryer in the room. Breakfast each morning was simple, quick and filling. They do have wifi but it only works in the lobby area or they do have a public computer for internet use. Overall we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitality, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LeadfootMcKraken
Reviews.Content: Pros: The owner is friendly and hospitable and went out of his way to make us comfortable. When we arrived at 11am expecting to just drop off bags and go find lunch before we could get our room ready, he immediately got us some orange juice while we waited for him to check the rooms - and then he got us our room right away. Our room had a low ceiling, but was clean and comfortable with a great view of the Singel canal. Location is fantastic, easy walk to about anything important, or to trams if not. Cons: Narrow spiral staircase or coffin-sized lift, your choice: neither is particularly good. Free wifi downstairs in the lobby, but it didn't work in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful character, great value and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tsl1965
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice, once in 2005 and again in 2010. This is a 17th century canal house with 8 rooms (2 singles, 6 doubles or bigger) on the Singel Canal just west of the central Dam area. The location is perfect - very close to the city center but just far away enough from the noise of the Red Light District. The area can be a bit loud on Sat night, but quiet enough during weeknights. Easy walk to the train station. There are some red lights in the area, but just ignore them if they bother you. The rooms are full of character (all are named after Dutch artists) but simple. The 2 single rooms (Hals, Meestag) each have a twin bed, small nightstands, small desk/chair, flat screen tv, a retrofitted en-suite bathroom. Breakfast is served at 830 in a glorious breakfast room and is hearty (boiled egg, muffin, roll, croissant, OJ, tea/coffee) but repetitive. There is an internet terminal available 8-8 each day. The price (60 euros per night for the singles) is unbeatable - you can pay that much for a bunk bed in the RLD. Hit or miss getting a room, since people book weeks in advance. Cash only. Perfect stay for Amsterdam, but just remember that this is a simple 1 or 2 star canal house, not a 5 star full service hotel - but far more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible-one of the highlights of entire trip”
Reviews.Author: MichaelZLA
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation at the Hotel Brouwer initially about 1.5 years in advance. I read the reviews and since they only have eight rooms, I wasn't about to take any chances. Despite my high expectations that grew that year and a half, I'm happy to say they even exceeded them. Perfect location on a canal in the middle of everything with every room having views. Charm that you can only find in a smaller place that's been around a while. I need to start staying in smaller hotels! Everything has an antique feel to it, including the oft-reviewed tiny elevator(which is small but can still fit two people or one person+suitcase). Between the feel of the place and the location, you truly get a taste of Amsterdam. Breakfast was delicious and the service was very friendly. Also, having the community computer downstairs was very helpful. Between that, and little touches like the tv's and bathrooms in each room, they took a very old building and added just enough modern features to make it comfortable yet not lose its stunning charm. I will certainly try to stay there on every future trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great First Trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JustSomeGuyDenver
Reviews.Content: This review is late in coming but I wanted to let everyone knew what a great time we had at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and we loved the view from our room (Escher). We did not spend all that much time in the hotel as we were sightseeing as much as we could. We did get a good nights sleep in the hotel and loved the location. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: travelmeisteren
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 12th stay at Hotel Brouwer in Amsterdam. We spent 4 nights in the Breitner room on the north side of the second floor. We've stayed in all but one of the hotel's 8 rooms. The Breitner (all rooms are named after Dutch painters) is quite nice. All rooms have a view of the Singel canal. The owner and staff are all very nice, everyone speaks English, and the location is great. We brought our bikes and biked around Amsterdam one day and another we trained to Haarlem then biked back along the canals and fields. It's a wonderful way to see Holland and the cities. As the title says, this is the only place we stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “some positives, some negatives”
Reviews.Author: albertoV05
Reviews.Content: We've been at Brouwer for 3 nights. We choose this hotel because it is near the station, situated on a canal and the reviews are mostly positive. Posive points: The reception was very nice and cordial. We were late and we were afraid the reception would be closed. Hopefully, the man working there that night was waiting for us. The view on the canal from each room is beautiful. The room are large and clean. The breakfast is good (not exceptional) but with no variety. negative point: The double bed was in fact 2 single beds pushed together. The mattress was too soft and dug in the middle so we didn't sleep very well. I knew the situation was near the red light district but in fact there is red light windows on Singel street and on the streets around. It can be disturbing for some, especially if you are with children. Just be award that walking to the hotel you will cross red windows. We could not access internet with wifi from our room, but there was a computer available for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--good bed”
Reviews.Author: PamSutherland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was on the canal and near the train station. I thought that the hotel was perfect for me. It's noisy, but nothing that some ear plugs won't resolve. My room was small, but had a window on the canal with desk that I could sit at and upload my photos. The Internet wireless worked well. I was there the day of the World Cup Parade and enjoyed seeing some of the boats go past my window. Breakfast was okay, but nothing outstanding. The staff was helpful and friendly. The elevator worked fine while I was there. The steps are very steep. There are some red lights near by, but there is a great restaurant for Belgian food one canal over. It was an easy walk to the train station. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: uk*bag*lady
Reviews.Content: Last month I spent a week at the Brouwer ~ I've lost count of how many times I've stayed there over the years. But I wouldn't stay at any other hotel. The Brouwer, although tiny, has everything I want in a hotel: a great room with good private facilities. A pleasant location and view. Friendly staff and a breakfast that sets you up well for a days sightseeing. It is a small hotel but it's full of history and character : even the crooked windows and floors have their own charm. It is very central too: just a few minutes from Dam, a short walk to the Jordaan and to many of the attractions people visit the city to see, such as the Royal Palace, the Anne Frank house and the floating flower market. The nearest tram stop is about 30 seconds away and Centraal Station but a ten minute walk. There is plenty of literature within the hotel to help you decide on a day out or a local restaurant and there is free Internet access if you need it. Oh yes, and a small but very useful lift/elevator for those who may need it. A great place in a great location. What more could you want? :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good location and views, but poorly run”
Reviews.Author: Bethesda14610
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Brouwer for a few nights in November of 2004, in the Mondriaan room (on the top [third] floor). The owner couple were then living on-site and it seemed well run, although he was verbally uncommunicative and she was rather perfunctory (far from a "welcoming" atmosphere). We stayed there again last month - for six nights this time - and in the same room. The owner couple no longer live on-site and they now have a revolving crew of workers, none of whom seems to communicate with anyone else working there (much less, with the owners). The American woman working there was rather *nasty*, which wasn't appreciated. When I made the reservation this time around, I was very explicit in making sure the elevator goes to the top floor (I couldn't remember after several years and the web site description was unclear), because I now have problems with one of my knees and the Brouwer is VERY tall & has many steep/narrow stairs (as is certainly typical of old buildings in Amsterdam's city center [and the reason why we wanted to stay on the top floor is because we didn't feel like listening to creaking floors until late at night when people walked around above us, plus the view is best]). On THREE of our six days there, the elevator didn't work when we attempted to go downstairs! To make matters worse, I was TRAPPED inside the elevator on two of those days (for *several minutes* each time) and it was quite frightening (the elevator is *miniscule*, which is certainly understandable - but "claustrophobic" is an understatement when you're trapped inside it). Supposedly the elevator repair people were called each day and supposedly they repaired the elevator each day (certainly on the *third* day, but I wonder about the other two days). On top of all that, the person who was working there on the first two days it happened had the GALL to tell me I shouldn't expect a working elevator and that I should have stayed on a lower floor if it was going to be a problem!!! When I finally managed to "escape" from the elevator each time, I had to walk all the way down with severe knee problems (I was also wearing a brace on the problem knee). The breakfast was pretty good, but that's standard for the Netherlands - although it's not so incredible that I would rave about it (however; unlike another reviewer, I thought the coffee was decent). Lastly; with the exception of our arrival day, it was quite obvious that no one cleaned our room (especially the bathroom) for the duration of our stay. The hotel is certainly clean overall - and the breakfast room is admittedly very cozy & charming - but still....

Reviews.Title: “Ask for dinner!”
Reviews.Author: Steve344
Reviews.Content: Marooned in Amsterdam (ha!) by the volcano in mid-April, I found my way to the Brouwer, a lovely place I'd been before. Personable staff always make me feel welcome and even at home there, with Ellen cooking dinner for the rest of us similarly stuck. The wonderful canal-front dining room isn't usually used except for breakfast, but Ellen says she can be talked into dinner if there's demand. Excellent Dutch-American inn fare, and well worth it just to eat family style by their great windows.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: KnJ66
Reviews.Content: Really nice view from room of a canal and trees. Only 5 minutes walk from Centraal station, Red light area and Dam Square. Good value and it also includes breakfast - juice, boiled egg, roll, croissant and a cup of tea. Lovely staff. Room was spotless and decent sized bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: murphy82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband the first week in March for 3 nights and loved every bit of it. The hotel is very charming and exactly what we had been expecting and hoping for - I was even more delighted when shown to the cute attic room with it's amazing views (who cares that the double bed is two singles pushed together - this is quite normal in Europe). If you want a characterless, could be anywhere in the world when inside as they all look the same kind of hotel then this isn't for you, but if you want to stay somewhere that is clean, cared for, superbly located and is honest to its surroundings then this is definitely the place for you. The staff were very friendly, the breakfast set you up for the day and all in all I would say it's somewhere I would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gwillgolf
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 4 nights here. The hotel is not fancy, but the rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and the location is terrific. You are not far from the central train station and just 2 blocks from a main tram line. The canal views are nice. The room is small, and our double room was two twins pushed together. But it was a convenient way to see Amsterdam. If you want luxury and a lot of services, this isn't your hotel, but if you just want a reasonably priced hotel in a good location in Amsterdam, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but otherwise very basic”
Reviews.Author: Apple10Perthshire
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel for a 3 night stay as wanted typical dutch house on canal. Location was excellent with fantastic views of the Singel Canal,but room and service basic. Definitely a quirky hotel which is very different from your normal run of the mill chain hotel -just not sure location is enough to justify this hotel's rating on trip advisor. We were on 3rd floor, up in the attic so views great but it was a long way up when the lift didn't work- which was on a daily basis. Breakfast was the same everyday. There was no choice- boiled egg with cheese and rolls. Hotel relies on location to sell rooms. Staff need to be more vigilant about service quality. Don't think I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of character”
Reviews.Author: jgoesSkem
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and courteous, the location was superb, only a few minutes walk from the station and within easy walking distance of the city centre. We had great vews of the canal from our room. This was at the top of the building, the only draw back was a degree of noise from the plumbing. We loved the old fashioned breakfast room, and the rolls, croissaants, boiled eggs, and cheese provided were excellent. We would certainly go there again

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mrsheathershaw
Reviews.Content: We were a little anxious as some of the reviews lately have been very mixed but we had a great stay. Yes, the staff were not the same every day but all were helpful and polite and provided extra pillows and ice for our drinks faster than some 5 star hotels we have stayed in. The lift was an adventure every time but as we had the attic rooms we were glad to have it. Both our rooms were clean and the bathrooms fantastic. The towels didnt match but who cares as they were clean as was the bed linen. Location was superb and breakfast fine.Free internet was always working and available and a real bonus. Yes , there are a few "red lights" near by but we felt safe at all times and would recommend this unique hotel to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectation”
Reviews.Author: Robbie524
Reviews.Content: Made very welcome upon arriving. Great location beside the canal, Beautiful views and allowed one to experience the everyday people in Amsterdam. Life very small, but added to the quirkyness of the hotel. Three couples - rooms all great. Very clean. Breakfast plentiful and service excellent. Easy walking to trams, main train station, red light district, cafes. Able to leave our bags at the hotel for a couple of hours after checkout . Communication for booking was so easy. Easy access to Ann franks House and the hop on hop off canal boats. Look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: jelipe
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Clean spacious room. Good breakfast. A little bit noisy outside at night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brouwer A Gem”
Reviews.Author: valfrnandz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Brouwer during our first trip to Amsterdam in May of 2009. The Brouwer is a quaint canal house conveniently located in the heart of Singel 83. We stayed in the Vermeer room for three nights and we were very comfortable during our stay. Our room was spacious (for European standards), clean, and had all the amenities we needed. An added bonus was our room overlooked the canal. Yes, the Brouwer is located on the edge of the red light district. However, that never bothered us and we felt completely safe during our stay. My only complaint is that a double bed in Europe is nothing more than two twin beds pushed together. At times the beds would shift away from each-other creating a gap - small complaint. We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Brouwer and hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brouwer - convenient location, nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: walk1103
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Brouwer on a recent trip to Amsterdam. It cost about 95 euros, which when converted to dollars was about $135 at that time. The hotel is small, but our room was fairly large, very clean, had a recently updated bathroom and small flat screen TV. We stayed in the Vermeer Room, which had a nice view of the canal outside the front of the hotel. The only drawback was that we had two twin beds that were pushed together to form a large bed. Of course, this did not work over the course of the night, but we managed. The best thing about the hotel is its location. It is within walking distance of the train station and most must-see sights. We spent 5 days there and walked everywhere, except when we took a train out to Zaanse Schans for the day (very touristy, by the way, but worth it if you like windmills). One small complaint is that breakfast did not start until 8:30 AM, which for us was a late start on the day. Also, they do not try to accommodate people who have to leave early for the airport. If you leave before 8:30, sorry, but no breakfast for you. Other than that, we thought the staff were generally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: evtravelAustralia
Reviews.Content: because of its location and price booked this hotel on the internet direct via email with the hotel the correspondence was always excellent when we first arrived our immediate thought was "oh my god what have we done what a dive'" BUT DON'T LET LOOKS SPOIL YOUR EXPERIENCE the place is very very very very old, The elavator could only hold one person sitting on one suitcase it was the smallest elevator I have ever seen we only used it to send our bags up and down we used the stairs all the time we were there as the elavator was scary for us there are two sets of stairs one spiral modern and one very old wooden when I used these stairs I craweld up hands and knees and went down back to the wall one step at a time as the steps are very narrow and steep but it wasn't a problem I got used to it after day 2 we had the Rembrandt room what a surprise a very spacious and clean room with windows all around views overlooking the canal GREAT To sum it up All I can say is the building is centuraries old and so is the furnishings modern by no means the house has a lot of history which adds to its character we had a wonderful experience stayed 5 nights breakfast was good the rooms were cleaned everyday the staff were great friendly and very helpful ( we only saw them at breakfast time but you can ring the bell if needed at other times) we had a very early morning departure the janitor made us hot crossants to take with us as we would of missed breakfast and also confirmed all our flights for us as the free internet wasn't working the location is excellent free internet price very affordable for amsterdam we would stay here again on our next trip to amsterdam it is on the corner of the red light district but it is not a problem at all on our travels around europe we stayed in much more modern hotels and paid much more for the privaledge but we had the best time and memories at the brouwer if you want to stay in all day then stay at a 5 star resort but if you want to experience the real amsterdam this is the place

Reviews.Title: “This Is Not A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: painallday
Reviews.Content: After a seven and one half hour flight we arrived at the Hotel Brouwer at 8AM and stepped into what we thought would be a Lobby, but found it was "The Breakfast" room and many were having breakfast. The one staff person there suggested that we put out bags into the office (which was filthy and covered with dust) and come back at 11AM when our room would be ready. No offer of breakfast or coffee. The Staff person did give us directions to a coffee shop. We picked this supposed hotel on location and our travel date based on time that they had a room available. I was celebrating my 60th birthday and decided to wait along with my friend based on the positive reviews about the hotel. I have no idea who wrote them, but I'll not be fooled again. We refused to wait for 11AM because we were both tired from the long flight and returned at 10AM the room was ready. And what a room. From pictures on Web Sites the rooms appeared large nicely decorated each with a different theme. To our surprise the room was very small, sparsely decorated, no place to hang your clothing, and paper thin walls. A sign on the door stated "Even when inside the room please use the chain lock for your safety". We found this disturbing. When given the key we were told that sometimes the front door was locked and we could use the side entrance. The side entrance was facing a street that had numerous "Coffee Shops", was the heart of the Red Light District and various unsavory activities going on. If you didn't open the side door wide enough you ran into a huge beam. The noise from the street was loud and always there. The location was one of the reasons we decided on this "hotel" overlooking the canal. There were no amenties. No staff person was ever around after breakfast and you couldn't get a cup of coffee or water or room service, the towels were rough and looked old and dingy. Also, because there was no staff around the front door was consistently locked and you had to use the side door. We were going to stay five days as scheduled, but changed hotels instead. We stay here only 2 nights, more than enough. The best thing that can be said about the Hotel Brouwer is that it is not a Hotel. The least that can be said is that it calls itself a Hotel. It is a canal house that offers nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for the right guests”
Reviews.Author: cl1811
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Brouwer recently for 2 nights as a single woman travelling alone. I was a bit disappointed when I arrived, but I had been spoiled by a few nights at absolutely gorgeous B&Bs in Belgium and was tired from a train journey. Once I'd had a rest and a walk around the canals I realized that the Brouwer is a good value for the right clientele. It's a very easy walk from Centraal Station and Damrak Street (where there are trams and starting points for bus tours). Also a short walk to the Anne Frankhuis. I didn't think the businesses or people on the street were any scruffier than other streets in the area. My room was on the 3rd floor and I wasn't bothered by street noise. The Brouwer is a reasonably priced small hotel in a historic building. That means the building is old, but my room and bathroom were in good condition. My bathroom was very modern and clean and the radiator in the shower stall was nice to have on a cold morning. My room had a modern television and a nice view of the canal. Breakfast included was very good. Boiled egg, cheese, breakfast breads, butter, jam, juice, coffee/tea. Here's some tips for prospective guests: It's an older hotel with a very tiny lift and steep spiral staircase. Anyone with mobility issues, lots of large luggage, fears of tiny elevators/lifts, etc. should be aware of this. There are maps and a few brochures in the little area near the computer (free use for guests) but you're pretty much on your own for finding tours to take, etc. I walked to Lindbergh tours office on Damrak street and booked my excursions there. I recommend the halfday tour to Marken and Volendam especially. If you need a full-service hotel with tour desk, large lifts, restaurant, etc., this is not the hotel for you. If you're looking for a low-priced hotel with decent location this place is good.

Reviews.Title: “If you are American, I would not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferJK
Reviews.Content: We booked a 5 night stay at the hotel in february 2009. Our stay began August 8. When we arrived, the owner was not there, the manager was not there and a maintenance man was left running the place. There are only 8 rooms at this hotel. Seven are modern and the other is a dump. Guess what room we (the americans) got? And remember we reserved six months in advance. Let me tell you a little about this room. You go up an old spiral staircase, and I mean old, steep and wore out wooden spiral staircase that starts from the hotel office. You unlock the door and enter the "room" or should I say the bathroom door. Then you have to go up another six or so steep and narrow winding stairs and you come to a bedroom on the right (reasonably ok), then you have to turn left and go up another steep and narrow five steps or so and you come to a room that has an old wooden table and chairs in the middle and a old double size bed built into the room in the corner. The bed (and its enclosure), table, chairs and chest look like they had been resurrected from the middle ages. Worn out would be a complement. The floor was so uneven that we set a bottle of wine on the wood table and it would slide off all by itself! The floor of some sort of stone tile had many broken or missing pieces and was unsightly as well as filthy from all the dirt and crap in the open gapping cracks. Now here is the real clincher. Several boxes of rat poison were set about the floor of the room and I accidently kicked one and rat poison pieces scattered throughout the worn out tile floor. This "room" is on three levels with steep and very narrow steps leading to each level. An accident waiting to happen at the least and a major pain in the rear to use. Bathroom (very nice and modern I would add) on the lowest level, a separate bedroom on the second level and the main room (the real dump) on the upper level. All the stairs starting from the office level look like they have been around since before Columbus discovered America. All the stairs are steep, narrow, totally worn out and absolutely filthy. After the first night we asked to be moved to another room, which fortunately the manager accomodated. Had this not been done we would have checked out. In our 30+ years of travel throughout the world, this hotel (this room in particular) ranks as one of the worse. As I said, there are seven modern rooms. From reading other comments about this hotel on this site, the rooms vary tremendously in size, bathroom amenities, etc. And the double rooms are all charged the same rate. So you pay the same rate for the rathole (our first night), the room we stayed in for four nights(reasonably nice) and the better rooms still on the 2nd and 3rd floor. Fair? You decide. Again, we reserved our room six months in advance. I doubt that the rathole was the only one available at that time. The hotel advertises internet (downstairs) and wifi in the rooms. Wifi never worked and the internet computer was down for two of our days. During the day there was no one around if you had any questions or needed assistance. The night before we checked out, at 11 pm we got back to our room and our phone was ringing. It was the manager insisting that we pay up then and not the next morning. We had to leave at 8 am and I guess that was to early for him to be at the hotel. Had he informed us the day before of this condition, I would have just paid him for the stay then. I told the manager he would be paid at 8 am the next morning and if he didn't like it, too bad. He finally after some grumbling agreed. Bottom line is this: Nice location on the canal in the heart of the touristy area, all rooms have view of canal and seven of the rooms are decent I guess. If you make a reservation at this place insist on one of the seven modern rooms and preferably on the second or third floor. Under no circumstances take the room that leads up from the downstairs office. That is the dump. No airconditioning here, so it can be warm and stuffy in the rooms with the windows closed because street noise can get quite loud from all the drunks wandering around until the wee hours of the morning. And did I mention the several piles of human excrement outside the door on the day we left? All in all, I can't recommend this place for the simple reason, in my view the hotel ownership is dis-honest. Anyone should be told about the dump room if that is where they are going to be staying WHEN THEY BOOK. I simply can not get past this. In my opi

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Roadking7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the spacious Mondriaan room on the top floor. It is a long way up in a small elevator.. The room had both tub and shower, a real plus. The beds though small were comfortable and clean. We had a huge window that opened up with a view on the canal. We loved that at night. With the window closed, the noise from outside wasnt bad. Our daughter slept in a rollaway that was very comfortable. Breakfast wasn't big, but the coffee was good, and the food was adequate. The free computor was great for checking email. Don't forget your key, you need it to open the hotel side door for entrance at night. Terrific location, easy walk to dam square and the tram line. Easy walk to Anne Franks house. About a 20 minute slow walk on coblestone streets to Central Station. $15E ride by cab to the cruise ships. Not luxurious or plush, but it is good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: worshiguchi
Reviews.Content: As we said before, this is an ideal spot in Amsterdam. Sure, the crowds unloading from Dam Square in the wee hours see the side street as a natural exit, which can mean it is noisy at times. But we sleep through anything, so that is not a problem. The rooms are Spartan in the eyes of some, but the beds are comfortable, they are spotlessly clean, the period detail is gorgeous (the pictures do not lie), and while the showers are not the enormous slate tiled sanctums found in luxury hotels, the water pressure is good and the end result is the same. You stay at the Brouwer because it is a steal--95 euros a night. It is also safe, comfortable and well located. The owners and staff are very hospitable, "Gentle" the new dog is just that, and did I mention that breakfast is included? We will never stay anywhere else, assuming we can get a reservation--plan early, with six doubles and two singles they stay full.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Gjersee
Reviews.Content: We just got home from 3 weeks in Europe and ended our stay in Amsterdam at the Brouwer. Though it WAS clean and certainly no frills, it was the first time during our three week stay that I didn't feel safe. Perhaps it was the long line of prostitutes that lined the alley behind the hotel or the note on the door stating that for your safety lock and chain your door. We had an early morning flight out the next day and there was not even an offer of coffee or a roll though breakfast was included. The towels provided were dingy and yellowed and something that I would expect from a much cheaper hotel. We were up and out of there as soon as we woke up. I would never recommend this hotel. There has to be better values out there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevieboyUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day stay at Hotel Brouwer. We had the two rooms on the top floor. This is the third time we have stayed in Amsterdam and our first time here and we were VERY impressed with the hotel. The rooms were an incredible size with bathrooms that were bigger than the hotel we last stayed at in Amsterdam. It was very well situated with a 5 minute walk to Damrak. Breakfast was great and made as you came downstairs. It was built in I think the 1600's so the floors sloped a bit which made it very quaint (and interesting after a night in a coffeshop!!) The only dissapointment we had was that they did not accept credit or debit cards - it was cash only - in this day and age thats not a good thing but we can live with that. We will not hesitate to stay here again and at the price we were charged we were amazed. We cannot recommend it highly enough

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: crjask
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of a trip including England and Paris. Good location as we arrived by train and were able to walk to it and most things from it. We were in the Mondriaan room in the attic. Long way up in either the very small elevator (2 people or 1 person with suitcase) or spiral (scary) staircase. Room was very clean, canal view and large bathroom. I would think that rooms on the 2nd and 3rd rooms below us had better views because we had to physically stand at the window to see anything. We couldn't see the street below us because the gutters stuck out below us. We did have cross ventilation with 2 windows which was appreciated because it did get warm while we were there. I wouldn't want to be in that room if the temperature got into the high 80's for a few days. Had to ask for a hairdryer but one was provided. A computer was available for use which was helpful when checking in for our flight home. I was able to use it a couple of times to check email also. Breakfast was at 8:30 and very sparse-- coffee/tea, orange juice, rolls/croissants, cheese and a hard boiled egg. Every day the same. But the price is right so you can't expect a feast but a little fresh fruit would have been greatly appreciated. The only thing that I didn't like was that the lobby closes up at 6pm and if you have a problem you are out of luck. Your room key opens up a side door and you come and go as you want, but I wondered what would happen if you misplaced your key. If you are looking for an authentic canal house at a very reasonable price that is not fancy but very clean, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but with character”
Reviews.Author: roadtripping1
Reviews.Content: This is a moderatele priced b&b and I think you get exactly what you pay for. The place has a lot of character, very cozy and homey feeling. Our room was big and bright with great views of the canal. Furnishing is absolutely basic and no frills but very clean. The structure itself is weird very tiny spaces with steep stairs (I wouldn't recommend it for the elderly!). Breakfast was good and served in a nice front room. Overall the place looks like somebody's house turned into a b&B and that's exactly what it is. We've been several time in Amsterdam and accommodation can be pricey if you don't go hostel style: this place is great value for money, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little gem”
Reviews.Author: KattiMalmoe
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is hidden 10 min walk from the trainstation and we had a great stay there in April this year. The room was big with a great canalview and great service. Breakfast (served 8.30) was big enough for a good start in the morning. The hotel lies with a walkingdistance to most seeings, which is great because Amsterdam is a lovely town to walk in. There is even free internetaccess, but then you have to be up early or try late in the evening, because the computer is always occupied. Yes, there can be some noises from the streets in the evening and yes, you can go "windowshopping" around the corner, But so what! This is Amsterdam. Would I stay here again? Definitely

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: NZTourists
Reviews.Content: This hotel, built in 1682, is full of character and history, matching the olde world atmosphere of Amsterdam. We stayed in the Mondrian room on the top floor. It was spacious, clean and bright, with old style furniture. The bathroom was also very spacious. The windows gave us fresh air and fabulous views. Breakfast consisted of croissants, bread rolls, & boiled eggs. It was served in the breakfast/reception room. The staff serving at reception and at breakfast was always friendly and cheerful. The hotel is an easy 10-15 minute walk from the railway station. Amsterdam is a great city to explore by foot. Don't be concerned by the hotel's official 1-star rating. For the price we paid (Euro 95.00), we were very happy with this hotel. Better pillows would have helped, and tea/coffee making facilities would have been appreciated. But overall, this affordable hotel made our stay in Amsterdam very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: skirt
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Brouwer last week for our 20th anniversary and loved it. Amsterdam is an expensive place to visit these days, and this hotel is brilliant value, when others aren't. We stayed in Escher on the top floor and were happy with the room. The bed was comfy, the bathroom large and clean and the views from the windows brilliant. Breakfast in the gorgeous downstairs room was lovely and was served by friendly staff. Loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean hotel right in the heart of Amsterdam overlooking canal”
Reviews.Author: julphil
Reviews.Content: What a find - a great little bed and breakfast hotel overlooking the canal. Very economical plus walk everywhere - Dam Square, Red Light District, Train Station, Anne Frank's house - would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent B & B in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Newtraveller66
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in April 2009 and found the place great. We had a top floor room which was not an issue as there was a lift to get our luggage up to the room. Yes the lift is very small but after travelling through Europe and many places have many stairs and no lift, I would take anything. The location was great, yes there were some "windows" close by but you are in Amsterdam so what do you expect. Our room was light and airy. It was very clean and quite large for Europe standards. Our towels were changed each day and beds made. The owners were always around to help us and allowed us to use their fridge and microwave. I would come back to this establishment next time I visit Amsterdam and recommend to my friends and family. Thank you for making our stay great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this atmospheric place”
Reviews.Author: jentartan
Reviews.Content: Having come from another more modern and boring hotel - this was a breath of fresh air. The place has the air of a lot of Dutch paintings - beamed ceilings and dark furniture in an old canalside house. We stayed in the Vermeer room with a great view. Spotlessly clean, and atmospheric - my son aged 12 loved it which was a pleasant surprise. Close to everything. Yes, there are a couple of red lights further up the street, but nothing "in your face" apart from the lights! If you like shabby chic this is a good place for you. Good breakfast included in price.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the cost. Yes, you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDootie
Reviews.Content: Convenient to railroad station, free high speed internet helpful. Nice canal view. Tired, but clean. Nosier than other areas, but we stayed there during the week so noise did not interfere with our sleep. Breakfast room looked very pleasant but since we left mornings before 8 can't judge food itself. Yes, warnings on inside of bedroom door to chain it shut for your protection. As one reviewer earlier reported, "windows" close by , refering to red lights right next door. It is defintely within a red light district.. Without the warnings within the hotel I would not have felt threatened. Ironically, we had the same problem with taxi ordered by them as another guest reporting in the same week, except that they called us in our room to say that the taxi was waiting. We were quoted 30E, and upon arriving at the airport we were told 45E by the driver. This was the cab ordered by the hotel, as they knew the driver and helped us with our luggage into the taxi. Beware of their taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near city center”
Reviews.Author: ATLTraveler88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 10 minute walk from the train station. It was a bit odd to see some "working girls" on our street (guess they're not just in the Red Light District anymore). The rooms are cute (we had the Mondrian room on the top floor) with a great view of the canal (all rooms apparently have a view of the canal). The bathroom was spacious (for Europe) with a shower and a tub. We had 2 beds and were on the corner, so had windows on 2 walls. It was a very convenient location - 15 minute walk to the Anne Frank Museum, 5 minute walk to the Dam, etc. Breakfast was included. It was simple - soft boiled egg, bread, jam, etc. They also have a computer to use free of charge. They also have probably the smallest elevator I've ever been in. I wouldn't recommend it if you're claustrophobic. The owner seems a bit gruff, but that wasn't a problem. You can't beat the price and location. You need to pay in cash and pay them the day before if you're leaving before 8 am.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky is the word!”
Reviews.Author: RomanHans1
Reviews.Content: If you like quirky, you'll like this place. They don't get quirkier. My room had loads of personality, and a fantastic view of the canal. Also, the price is right. However, there are quite a few caveats. The place is VERY small and cluttered. The staircase is not for the squeamish. The mattresses are thin and lumpy. You get one pillow and a duvet barely larger than the mattress -- that's it. No top sheet, no blanket. (They have no queen or king beds, just double beds pushed together.) The employees aren't helpful. The desk clerk gave directions that were impossible to understand and then refused to repeat them. He had no idea what the "Nine Streets" neighborhood was, saying that he'd lived there for many years and I must be mistaken. There's exactly one public area in the hotel -- the restaurant/breakfast area -- and it closes at six. The warnings posted on the interior walls about theft are frightening. Last, every time I tried to use the computer, someone else was using it.

Reviews.Title: “quirky, interesting, glad we stayed there”
Reviews.Author: 1of4Devon
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel. comfirmation e-mail quick to arrive good coms Service was good and nothing was too much trouble. the room ( Brietner )was on the 2nd floor beds were 2 singles but comfortable -nice linen bedding. good hot shower access via 2 different staircases or tiny lift No double glazing so some noise from road, but heating very good. 10 minute walk from centraal station eye opening displays nearby -if you don't want to see don't look. trams 50 mtrs from hotel various shopping areas easy walking distance interesting building with lots of nooks and crannys yes it is near the centre of amsterdam and the road next to the Singel canal can be ( comparatively) noisy and yes it is an old building from the 1600s so not too much can be done about sound proofing but we have had rooms in Krakow and Prague that were noisier. I f you want a quiet hotel then use one that was built more recently by a chain but could be in any city in the world

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: France0000
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with the last review. Didn't sleep well due to the noise from the street. The windows are very thin. The bed was also too soft. I appreciated having a TV in the room and having access to free internet. While the location was ideal and the breakfast quite good , I would have preferred a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good !”
Reviews.Author: poeki
Reviews.Content: I Chose this hotel after reading so many positive reviews on tripadvisor,but I was really dissapointed in my stay there! The room itself was the most uncomfortable and smallest one I ever had in the world!!!!! The decoration is ugly en dated. It was not possible to close the curtains, and the noise from the street was absolutely not pleasant! Also a lot of noise from other rooms al night long ! Breakfast started at 8.30 hr, so it was not possible to have it,because I had to leave at 8 15 hr! The floors and windows are dirty,and the whole atmosphere is a litlle bit shabby and messy! The stairs and the elevator are horrible! For tourists who want to feel the real Amsterdam, maybe it is a great place because of the old historical building with nice location with canalview ,but with the two american lady owners? I did not have a real 'Amsterdam' feeling, I was verry happy that I could leave this place, and I will never , never , never go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxing break !”
Reviews.Author: evertonhse
Reviews.Content: Just to echo all the positive comments that have been said before - the hotel is not your ordinary bland hotel, where you are just a "number". The feel is like beiing in a 'home from home' with all the perfect touches that really made the break so relaxing. Wonderful room (The Rembrandt), with lovely views over the canal - the decore and the comfort was superb, as was the breakfast - glorious sitting in an environment that made eating the wonderful breakfast such an experience ! The staff were extremely friendly and very approachable - not like your normal hotel - we were served our delicious breakfast on real china plates, drunk our tea from real china tea, and served to you by the friendly, warm staff ! The hotel is in a superb position, just off from the main Dam square, but far enough away to feel that you are not on top of the centre of Amsterdam. A 10-15 minute walk from the centraal station, most of it along the Singel canal is very pleasant. We did all our sightseeing by walking, and it was a pleasure to get back to the lovely warm room to chill over a nice glass of wine - no fridge, but we left the wine next to the window, where there was a gap just big enough to let some cold air in ! This did not detract from the warmth of the room, as the central heating was so efficient, we had to leave the window open at times ! All in all, the recommendation from the Daily Telegraph back in October 08, was very welcome, and we were not disappointed - thank you to the hotel staff for making the stay so enjoyable !

Reviews.Title: “A small wonder”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Brouwer for 5 nights with a friend of mine - and we loved it! We got the Rembrandt room which was small but perfect for our stay. We spent our days seeing the city so our room was just our base with bed. We did watch TV in the evenings, though. The staff was wonderful and friendly, we felt like we could ask enything if we needed.
