The hotel is a charming old house and yes, some of the floors are a bit tilted but we thought it added to the ambience. Beds were comfy and I'm a fussy sleeper. So if you need bed, shower and breakfast, look no further! We could walk anywhere in the city from our hotel. There are some red lights but they didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Ambience.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous53
Reviews.Content: So much has been written about Hotel Brouwer, most of it rightly very positive, so I won't repeat it all. However, one or two recent reviews are a bit mealy-mouthed about this gorgeous, little canal house and I wanted to set the record straight! The main thing that some of the recent reviewers do not seem to appreciate, is that the hotel is decorated in simple, period style. It is deliberate! It is not "basic" but absolutely beautiful.The decor is such a joy. The bedrooms are beautifully tranquil, with their wooden floors and beautifully simple wooden furniture - upright chairs, charming wooden table, lovely Shaker-style wardrobe and so on. The beds are sweet and simple, the ben-linen white cotton with broderie anglaise or fine white decoration - and very frequently changed. Yet, the modern touches are there - a small flat-screen tv on a wall, a stylish metal floor lamp, metallic bedside lamps. The rest of the hotel is postcard pretty - it IS like being inside a Dutch interior! The breakfasts are delicious and everything on the table is stylish and lovely. Such care has been taken to give guests a perfect impression. The staff are great and really friendly - it IS like being in a home, especially in the morning - and having free internet access by the dining area is brilliant. I have gone on a bit but I SO wanted all you readers to go ahead and book this place - in advance, because it is VERY popular! Truly, you will be charmed as we were. We cannot recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Brouwer Hotel - A true Gem of a Place!”
Reviews.Author: HippoLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, charming canal house, spotlessly clean and with the friendliest of hosts. What more could you want? I'll definitely be telling friends and family about this gem of a hotel which is situated on the Singel canal overlooking one of the beautiful bridges. You'll not need a tram, bus or metro pass from here as the major sights are all within walking distance and walking in Amsterdam is great. The substantial continental breakfast with wonderful coffee set me up for much of the day - so that I could enjoy all Amsterdam's wonderful museums, sights and happenings. Cannot wait to revisit this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “simply perfect!”
Reviews.Author: amicadeglianimali
Reviews.Content: Other people wrote everything about this hotel. So, I only can repet it's perfet for the centrality (five minuts walk from the Station or dam square). The tram (number 2 - 9 - 5 for going to Ledseplein, museumplein, Rembrandtplein) is just to the end of the litlle street. The hotel is very close to Anne Frank house, to the best important shopping streets, and the view over the singel canal, that it enjoys from the windows, is fantastic. The hotel is very familiar, does not seem to be in a hotel but at our home. The bed room (we were in the Veermer room) is very clean and the the breakfast room is romantic. The breakfast is right and the price very cheap. Although the hotel is in a small red light area, it's a very quiet area. We were three fifties ladies but we have not heard ever in danger. the owners are very willing. Near the hotel there is the famous Pankake Bakery (very good pankake). So, the most quality of the hotel are: cheap, clean, centrally located and romantic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Brouwer - Amsterdam's Best Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: Spottycatz
Reviews.Content: Read all the TA reviews before going but was still a little apprehensive until arrival. The website and photo's no way do this lovely wee hotel the justice it deserves. We stayed in the Rembrandt room and the views over the Singel Canel were a joy to wake up to. It is fabulous and the staff are so friendly. Breakfast was a delight every morning in the quaint breakfast room as were the chats with the lovely hostess and the other guests. Hotel Brouwer is faultless and we will never stay anywhere else now. Best value for money, spotlessly clean and most of all, fantastic location. "Amsterdam's Best Kept Secret!" 11/10

Reviews.Title: “A+ for the Brouwer!”
Reviews.Author: rcmaster2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a very convenient and quiet setting. Super clean room and entire building. Stayed on top floor (Escher room) and the stairs are a bit dizzying but there is a small lift. Great views of canal from every room. Breakfast served was excellent and hostess was very friendly. Very traditional canalhouse with 8 rooms and right on the Singel canal. 2 minutes walk to Damrak and less than 10 to Central Station. Also walking distance to Anne Frank House (10 minutes), Van Gogh Museum (30ish minutes), and everything else you could want/need. Convenient restaurants, bars, and coffeeshops within one minute of hotel. Free internet also a bonus. Excellent choice in Amsterdam and for the rate of 95 Euro I don't think you could do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: SmartMoney
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Brouwer having booked it based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and my limited knowledge of Amsterdam. It is in a great location on the Singel canal near to all the attractions and some good bars and restaurants nearby. The room we had was on the second floor and was spacious and clean with views over the canal. The breakfast was fine and staff seemed friendly. Unfortunately the two single beds were short and narrow â€“ not great if you are over 6ft. Our first night was a Saturday and it was extremely noisy into the early hours with shouting from drunks passing by and smashing bottles at one point. The windows are not double-glazed and as it is an old building they do not fit terribly well (I had to wedge one closed to stop it rattling during the night) so noise is going to be a problem because of its location. One window had no curtain and just a bit of gauze pinned over it which didnâ€™t look great. Between the street noise and small beds I didnâ€™t get a good night sleep during my 3 nights so can only give a neutral rating.

Reviews.Title: “Tons of character, a little short on comforts”
Reviews.Author: urbanfoodie
Reviews.Content: Really atmospheric hotel in a very convenient location. Especially in the breakfast room, it almost felt as if we were staying in an old Dutch painting. The small, 2 person elevator was interesting (not for claustrophobics) and the breakfast was very good. I found 95 Euro was a bit steep for this place, but it seems there is very little value for money in Amsterdam. It is so far the best place I've stayed in in the Dam. The only real complaint I'd have is that the beds are all single (the double room is just two singles pushed together) so you or your partner could end up falling between the beds. Not ideal. I noticed the smallish red-light area near the hotel I saw mentioned on here, but thought nothing of it. I figure if you're really prudish or conservative, you have no business being in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: dazk
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, walking distance from Amsterdam Central. Stayed in the Rembrandt room, which had a slightly sloping floor! Room was very clean, and provided a great place to stay for the night. Very friendly and accommodating hosts, and a brilliant breakfast as well - would highly recommend this place, even if it's just to check out one of the smallest lifts I've ever been in!

Reviews.Title: “Top Location, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dawnmichie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brouwer is a small hotel in central Amsterdam, about a 5-10 minute walk to the train station. It is located in a historic building facing the canal. We arrived in Amsterdam early in the morning, prior to check-in. The hotel let us store our bags there and fed us a delicious breakfast while we waited for our room to be cleaned. The breakfast room is perfectly-sized, and allowed us to meet the other guests staying in the hotel. All of the rooms have a canal view. Since this is a central location, you will probably hear some noise from the people below or the scooters passing by. If that bothers you, bring some ear plugs or don't get a canal-facing room. The room we stayed in was Breitner. It was quite large, clean, had a comfortable bed which smelled fresh like clean laundry. It had a bathroom in the room with toilet, sink and shower. It doesn't have air conditioning, but you can leave your windows open if you don't mind a little noise. There is a free internet terminal there, which was great. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. It is located near everything...walking distance to the train station, Joordan district, Dam Square, Anne Frank House, even the red light district. The hotel is in a safe neighborhood. Overall, I recommend that anyone stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: riftia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within 10 min walking from the central railroad station. All rooms overlook the "Singel canal". It is at the edge of the "red light district" with a few "display windows" within 100 feet of the hotel. My wife and I stayed in the Rembrandt room and were very pleased about our stay. The room was furnished with antiques, was quite large, had a comfortable bed and a nice bathroom. Each morning a breakfast of several breads, cheese, jam and coffee/tea was served in a comfortable downstairs setting. The proprietors were helpful, nice, and accommodating. The hotel has the tiniest elevator I have ever seen. Two people have to stand nose to nose in order to share it, it was an experience, especially if you had any baggage. However, the elevator worked and was quiet! I can highly recommend this hotel to everybody. It is quiet, comfortable, safe, and provides easy access to the central shopping areas and the railroad station.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Nelliesmom
Reviews.Content: This is not the Hilton but a small local owned little gem! My husband and I loved this hotel. It was very small and quaint. It was wonderful, we found it in one of Rick Steves' books. If you want something a little different then for sure go for this!!! You'll love it. It is in walking distance to the train station and many restuarants etc. There was a nice breakfast each morning and the manager was there we were able to visit with her a little. LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming old hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissJaneM
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the hotel Brouwer in May. We loved this hotel! We walked there in 10 minutes from Centraal station. We were in (I think) the Escher room - a large room in the very top of the hotel, with a big bathroom. The hotel is quaintly crooked, walking around the floor for the first time you feel like you are drunk! We had the most fabulous views of the Singel Canal (and beyond) from our top floor windows. The hotel has a spiral staircase, but being on the top floor, we stuck to the tiny lift (do not attempt to fit more than 2 people and a suitcase in this unless on very intimate terms!). They offer free internet access. The breakfasts are great, served in the lovely front ground floor room, and the manageress, Ellen, is a charmingly laid-back lady who was very friendly and helpful. Warning: do not pull the ears of the dear resident dog when patting her - she does not like it! We booked about 10 months in advance, knowing how few rooms the hotel has, and are very glad that we did.

Reviews.Title: “Characteristic of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: buckislove
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews from this site, I booked the Brouwer way back in November, and I was glad I did. It is a short walk to and from Amsterdam Centraal Station and so was convenient for coming and going from the city. It is right near Dam Square and is about a 15 minute walk from the Museum Plein, Anne Frank House, etc...we walked everywhere from here easily. They had a nice breakfast that was not a buffet, but rather was served to you. It included bread and a soft boiled egg. The rooms are accessed by a narrow spiral stair case (or small lift) and the hallways and narrow, but slope and lean wonderfully. It felt so authentic staying here. We had the Breitner room and it was great---canal views. There are a few places to eat literally steps away as well. If you want to stay in an authentic canal house with just enough classy amenities, then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Lover Hotel Brouwer”
Reviews.Author: drnorth
Reviews.Content: Perfect. Perfect location, good value, super charming building and rooms, very helpful and friendly staff/owners, right on a canal, great breakfast in a delightful room.......I have no complaints. It is a very short walk from the train station, so it is easy to get to and from the trains and the airport. I have stayed there twice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: ebenezer15
Reviews.Content: We loved this place and the location was perfect. Walked to the hotel in 8 minutes from the train station. Place was clean, free internet, great coffee, and wonderful staff. We did wonder when booked as they kept telling us they were full, we just kept emailing and finally ended up with three nights each for two couples, so don't be put off by the first no. I think they are selective. Stairs and lift are small and steep. But I would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “just what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: Chesserschoice
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from the Brouwer and thought I'd write a few comments. Party of two couples all in our late fourties. The hotel is exactly what you would expect from this part of Amsterdam.....it's charming, very clean........... close enough to the night life but certainly not to busy, yes, sure there are girls in the windows close by but isn't that what you would have expected. We had a good walk round and we thought this area was by far the nicest, busy if you wanted it and laid back if that's what you wanted. I can certainly reccommend this hotel and this part of Amsterdam........would I go back ????? of course.... in a flash, pardon the pun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Boulos
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our daughter's wedding in Amsterdam. We booked the Hotel Brouwer almost a year before and it was well worth it. The owner and staff were very accomodating and the hotel suited our every need. Location was so great. We could walk to and from Central Station which was our transportation to the airport and the meeting place for wedding guests when they arrived in Amsterdam. Breakfast was great, just loved the coffee and fresh baked goods. Security was never an issue. E-mail access was helpful with other family members because none of us had cell phones for Europe. We were there for Queen's Day, unbelievable experience. I could go on and on, however I just need to say you won't be disappointed. I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like Coming Home”
Reviews.Author: Glsgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Brouwer just about a year ago, and I loved it! I flew in from Venice, and (don't ask) missed my flight, so I arrived quite late at night. My hubby had called, and the owners were expecting me, and took me right up to my room. The room was tiny (I was alone, so it was perfect) and very charming, with a comfy bed, nice desk, and clean bathroom with shower. Great view over the canal! I really liked the breakfasts, fresh croissants, jam, cheese, eggs, juice, and really excellent coffee with thick, wonderful cream. Oh, yeah. Seriously good coffee. The location was great, close to Central station, and convenient to trams, buses, etc. (The lift....well, it's tiny. But it does the job. I have a stair phobia, so I did not attempt the stairs. Maybe next time.) I only had three days in Amsterdam, so I spent most of my time at museums, etc. but I'm going back this fall, and will certainly stay at the Brouwer again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Canal House!”
Reviews.Author: daisy6671
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the Hotel Brouwer in Amsterdam, and we can't recommend it highly enough! It's a wonderful old canal house. Staying here made it feel like we were really experiencing life like Amsterdammers! I am most comfortable making reservations directly, rather than through a 3rd party, so I actually called the hotel about 8 months before we left. We originally wanted to stay a week starting April 15th, but they were already completely booked - and even further on into the year. So book early! But they had a cancellation for the first week of April, so we decided to go with that. I had read that the Escher room was the most comfortable, so I decided to reserve that one, and fortunately, that's were the cancellation was. We stayed there for 5 nights, but it was already booked the last night so they moved us to the Van Gogh room. Both rooms were wonderful! I LOVED the huge bathroom in the Escher room. It was very quiet and peaceful. The bathroom had a shower, two sinks, a toilet and a tub. With all the walking you do in Amsterdam, it was wonderful to take a long, hot soak in the tub! The tub was narrow, but is very long and high. I really loved the lay-out of the Van Gogh room. It was also very quiet - we never heard anyone else moving around. The bathroom is smaller - it has one sink, one toilet and a shower (no tub). The room has TONS of windows, which I loved. Both rooms had two twin bed pushed together to make one bed, which was actually kind of nice (hubby tosses a lot). The comforters are thick and cozy to curl up under. The stairs are very narrow and spiral up to the top floor. We always took them going down, but usually took the elevator going up. The elevator is very tiny, but it does the job. It took us a coupla runs to get all my luggage up, which was fine. I was really glad they had an elevator! A lot of canal houses don't, and it was a wonderful convenience. The breakfast were simple but really good. There were croissants, rolls and crumpets with real butter and jam. We had coffee, juice and a variety of teas. There was also sliced cheese (which was wonderful) and soft-boiled eggs. The staff was friendly and helpful. They helped us take up our luggage up to the room (and I brought waaay too much luggage). Also, the day we switched rooms we were gone all day on a tour, and they moved all our luggage for us. That same morning we were leaving really early to go on a tour, and I had gone down to the lobby to check email before we left. While I was waiting for hubby the owner came in carrying a tray of croissants. When she found out we were leaving early she wrapped a couple up for us to take with us. Several times I went down to the main desk to ask for directions or recommendations, and every time they were patient and helpful. On the last day our flight left really early, and the day before they made a taxi restervation for us. (If we'd had less luggage we would've just taken the train from Centraal Station). They made our stay easy and comfortable! We loved the location - on the Singel Canal just a coupla blocks from Centraal Station. It was an easy walk to the Pancake Bakery, Wok to Walk, the Anne Frank House, Centraal Station, the Red Light District and Dam Square (where the Royal Palace, New Church and Madame Tussauds are). We found tons of cafes, stores for shopping, fast food and an ATM that takes foreign bank cards nearby. It is a bit further to go to the main restaurant and shopping street (Leidesplein), the museum district, or the club area (Rembrandtsplein), but it's a short, easy tram or taxi ride. I wish we had gotten the I AMsterdam cards, as you can ride any public transportation with the card. The Hotel Brouwer is the perfect hotel for really soaking up the Amsterdam experience. I love small B&B type places - I feel much more connected to the people and the places we visit, and the Brouwer was exactly what I was looking for and more than I expected. Now, my mom is a little more into convenience and comfort, and I know it wouldn't have been a good fit for her. I think that's where some of the less enthusiastic reviews have come from. If you're more into room service and valets, by all means choose a modern hotel that will help you make the very most of your stay! But if you're looking to really soak up the ambiance of Amsterdam, this is your place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Footballerswife
Reviews.Content: Perfect little hotel! Rooms (Vermeer): * Clean and quite big compared to average european * Flat screen TV * Canal view Area: * Close to Central station * Walking distance to main locations (we walked to Leidseplein and museums also) * Beatiful Jordaan nearby, good restaurants, market * Few red light windows, not a problem * Quiet Personnel: * Very friendly I can highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Wait to Return Some Day!”
Reviews.Author: Brklynz20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Brouwer back in October of 2007. I was originally referred to the hotel by the Rick Steves Amsterdam, Brugge, and Brussels guidebook. From there, I visited the hotel's website, and then the listing here on the tripadvisor site. Based on everything I had seen, plus the ridiculously central location, and all of the amazing reviews, I was very excited to stay here...especially for such a great price. This was my first trip to Amsterdam, and I was also traveling solo (I am a 26 year old female). When I initially contacted the hotel, they only had a single room available for one of the 2 nights I was going to be in Amsterdam (everything else was fully booked, and, understandably so after having stayed there). So, figuring that was better than nothing, I chose to reserve that room and make arrangements for the following night at another hotel, but I asked the hotel owner to please let me know if anything became available. I checked back with the hotel about a week later, and there were no single rooms available for my second night (still), but, having explained my situation about traveling alone, etc, the owner graciously offered me a double room for the second night at the single room rate. I was very impressed by that kind of hospitality, and greatly appreciated it. Switching rooms in between was a small price to pay to be able to stay at my #1 choice hotel. I arrived in Amsterdam hours before traditional "check-in" time, but they kindly allowed me access to my room to store my luggage so that I could spend time sightseeing while the room was being cleaned and prepared for my stay. The first night, I had a single, en-suite room...I believe it was called the "Mesdaq" room. It was small, but perfect. It had a very comfortable twin bed with fresh linens, a down comforter, etc. There was also a nice desk and chair that faced the window. The bathroom was small but functional with a good shower. The room also had a small clothes cabinet, an end-table with a phone, etc. It was simple, but perfect...exactly what I had been expecting, but somehow better once actually there. The view of the Singel Canal from my windows was wonderful! The second day, I moved to and stayed in the double room next door (I think it was the Van Gogh Room). There is only one word to describe this room (after having spent 2 weeks in budget hotels in the UK and France): HUGE! The two twin beds had been moved together to form one large double bed. There was also a nice table and chairs, a clothing cabinet, a larger bathroom than the previous room, and little shelves next to the beds with the phone, alarm clock, etc. The best part of this room, however, was the windows! This room is located on the 3rd (I think) floor of the canal house, and it is on the corner of the canal-side, so there are literally windows along two full walls of this large room. It was simply amazing and afforded simply beautiful views of the canals and streets below. I didn't want to leave! The hotel has a very small elevator which was perfect for getting my luggage up to the rooms. The spiral stairs were very steep, but fun! There was also a computer with internet access down in one of the ground level common rooms which was very useful for checking e-mail quickly, as well as confirming departure information for my flight, etc. Breakfast was served down in the breakfast room and was simple, but very, very good. It consisted of some cheeses, ham, tea, juice, and croissants/rolls. I had the opportunity to speak with the female owner during breakfast (and I cannot remember her name...I am pretty sure it started with a "J")....she was very, very nice and helpful. I enjoyed talking to her and learning more about the hotel's history...she is an American ex-pat, and was very friendly. The hotel istelf is very centrally located along the Singel Canal, less than a 10 minute walk to Amsterdam's Centraal Station. I walked/rode a bike everywhere in town and never once felt the need to use one of the trams. Nothing was more than a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel...it was perfect. The hotel does lie on the outer edge of the red light district (the heart of the red light district, however, is about 1/3 mile east of the hotel), but I never once felt unsafe or anything like that. In fact, it added some character to my stay! The next time I am in Amsterdam, I will CERTAINLY stay here again if rooms are available! This was the perfect, simple canal-house experience I had been hoping for...and the prices (for Amsterdam) were great!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: carkrisy
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a charming hotel within walking distance to the train station and several areas of Amsterdam. Breakfast is included and was a nice array of choices. I found the staff friendly. The room was basic very clean and roomy . I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “indifferent staff, red-light next door”
Reviews.Author: JohnGaltUs
Reviews.Content: Positive aspects were central location, comfortable older rooms with 3 to a floor, and rate. Negatives were several red-light windows/rooms on the street including ~next door, which we had not heard about in previous reviews and can make the location difficult with children, the staff was indifferent and breakfasts average. If staying there also ask for a high floor away from street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, comfortable, and inexpensive--would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: SusanH37
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Brouwer, and we really enjoyed our time there. The hotel is accessible and comfortable. There is one computer with Internet access off the main room that was available for us to use free of charge, as long as we didn't use it too long to preclude other guests from using it. There was no TV in the double room we booked, which was fine with us. We didn't spend a lot of time lounging in the room. The staff we encountered were friendly enough and helpful when asked, but not overly warm. The narrow stairs were not the easiest to navigate, but that is coming from someone who is not in the best of shape. We both liked that it was on the cusp/in the Red Light District. It added to our experience, actually, and it never felt seedy or scary there. It was a quick walk to Centraal Station and not far from the Anne Frank House, and easily accessible to many other areas where we wanted to go. While researching where to stay, I read the other reviews on TripAdvisor and decided to stay here, and we're glad we did. Amsterdam lodging can be expensive, and while this hotel wasn't luxurious, it didn't need to be. It was comfortable and clean, and perfect for what we wanted. In fact, when we arrived in our room, we both remarked how spotless it looked and how clean it smelled. My only complaint is the lack of shower guard that someone else mentioned. Our bathroom floor seemed to always be wet. And the walls seemed pretty thin at times, but we were right by the stairs on the first floor, so that may have been the problem. Anyway, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like the earlier man said -- you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: crisro
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how this hotel got rated so highly but, to tell the truth, the entire experience has caused me to doubt the ratings process of tripadvisor.com. For the money, I suppose it is fine, but it is nowhere near the top 100 in Amsterdam, let alone 20. The floors are so slanted (at least in the Van Gogh room) that my roommate and I had to leave after 2 nights of a planned 8-night stay because of her vertigo. There are no TV's or radios and, I know, I know... you don't come to Amsterdam to watch TV, but every so often it is nice to hang out at the hotel. At the Brower, all access to any common area is cut off at 6 p.m. You must go to your room, where there is not even a comfy chair or writing table... just a couple of hard backed chairs and two not-quite-twin sized bed which particularly slide apart (as noted in earlier reviews), especially when the the floor is at a slant. The management is courteous but not particularly friendly--we experienced (and we are fairly kind people in our sixties) very perfunctory, almost New York-rude service.... not the family atmosphere we had been led to expect. There is no wi-fi Internet service, even if you wanted to pay. Bottom line... if you are looking for a basic youth hostel, the Brower is great. If you want a hotel with any amenties... keep on looking. We ended up at a 4-star just down the street for only 10 euros more a night on a great special. Also, and none of the earlier reviews I read mentioned this... the Brower is right next to the red-light district and right next door, there are a couple lovely women displaying their wares -- something families not interested in this part of Amsterdam culture might not all enjoy. Just telling the truth here--the Brower is okay if you want bare bones hostel, but there is no way this is a top hotel or value in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I could not have imagined it any better!”
Reviews.Author: plasticbike
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 American women in Amsterdam = trouble... but not really. We felt as if we were home at the Hotel Brouwer, and acted accordingly. The house is truly historic, crooked in all the right ways and wonderfully maintained. The rooms are all clean, as are the bathrooms. The breakfast is small, but not to be missed, it felt like a family breakfast. The cheese is AWESOME! The stairs are, well, crazy. I am in very good shape, as were most of my friends, but we found ourselves deciding to not stop back for our forgotten sunglasses or maps or whatever we forgot to avoid the stairs... ah aha ha ha! But they are easier to climb with a few pints in you. ;) The hostesses were more than wonderful, in fact, we had a birthday girl in the group and her girlfriend in the US called the owners to set up a surprise party... and they did! they put beautiful flowers with a card in ther room and had the most lovely birthday cake complete with candles waiting for us on our return from dinner. What a special gesture! Of course they charged us for the flowers and cake (to be reembursed by the girlfriend back home), but I have a feeling they didn't make a dime off of it... the charges were so low! The location is perfect. You can walk to anywhere in the city within 30 minutes, and for those who are concerned that it is located too close to the red light disctrict, that's just silly. The entire city is the red light district. In fact, this is in a very nice, clean and calm part of the city... so don't be affraid at all of the location. The beds were ok... they could use new mattresses, really... they were not dirty, just well used. Overall, you CANNOT beat this place for the value/quality ratio... I cannot imagine staying anywhere else in Amsterdam without paying $400 a night for a 4 or 5 star place.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Brouwer”
Reviews.Author: SheilaMN
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Hotel Brouwer. We stayed there in May 2007 also. Both times we stayed in the Vermeer room which I really like. The location is great and it's very easy to walk almost everywhere. Love the breakfast - it's a soft boiled egg, tasty dutch cheese, some breads with jam and butter, OJ, and a big pot of french press coffee. The staff is great and the dog that roams about is very sweet. We have stayed in another hotel in Amsterdam and the charm of the Brouwer is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “good for a B&B”
Reviews.Author: Thefall
Reviews.Content: Well, you get what you pay for - this is absolutely right. Brouwer hotel has a good location, a reasonable price and good (though with the low ceiling) rooms. Breakfast is almost nothing, but there are lots of little cafes and restaurants in this area, so it's not a problem. They have no TV in the room, but this is also useless - you don't go to Amsterdam to watch movies, do you? I wasn't very impressed with the hotel - this trip convinced me that I need more comfort (not lower than a 4* property). But I do understand why other surveyors love Brouwer - the small family-run hotel in an old traditional building right in the heart of A'dam is a good choice for this city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brouwer great place in A'DAM”
Reviews.Author: randy_from_nb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Brouwer is a superbe B&B type hotel with very spacious rooms without costing an arm and a leg. View of canal from rooms are fantastic. Place is relaxing, quiet, very convenient if require a break from the mayhem of Amsterdam, also has the smallest elevator I have ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting small hotel with a great view”
Reviews.Author: CRose10328
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a brief sightseeing trip to Amsterdam. We were not disappointed. This is a small hotel in a really old building with lots of character and rooms with a view over the canal. The beds were comfy and bathrooms rather large. We didn't spend a lot of time in our rooms, but the hotel is convenient to the rail station. You can walk to most things. Breakfast was adequate as everyone said. We found the person at the desk to be helpful and friendly. It is on the edge of the redlight district. Actually in the same block you could see women in the windows, but I never felt unsafe at any time. We were on the top floor and walked the stairs whenever we were in and out. The lift was tiny. I'm not sure we'll return to Amsterdam, but if we did I'd be glad to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: Waterloon
Reviews.Content: Several couples chose the Brouwer during a recent visit to Amsterdam. We were all there to celebrate my wife's 40'th birthday. We chose the Brouwer based on many online recommendations (including here). We were not disappointed. The Brouwer is quaint, quirky (in a good way), convenient, clean, and affordable. It is in a good location close to the main train station, Dam Square, red light district, and good shopping. Note that it is somewhat distant from the museum areas and the main nightlife area (Leidseplein) but it's a very quick tram ride away from these spots. The actual area is quite safe but note that it is in the same row as a mini-red light district and you'll see some of the women who work the windows near the hotel. Also, this area has a lot of the "coffee shops" that Amsterdam is notorious for. On the bright side, it is close to Ann Frank house and the general Jordaan area that has a lot of cafe's and restaurants that the locals go to. The rooms are spacious and have just enough antique touches to make it not feel like yet another cheap hotel. There's even a small lift to help you get your luggage to your room. An accessible free internet terminal is also a big plus. The staff was universally friendly and helpful ... though, oddly enough, it seemed that the staff changed virtually every day. All rooms had great views of the Singel canal. In the evening, we were not bothered by rowdy street noise from late nighters. Breakfast was simple but very tasty. Our group was all 40-somethings used to traveling and have all experienced budget places and grand resorts. All of us agreed that the Brouwer was definitely worth the money and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ducky51
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Hotel Brouwer. It's a small, old hotel with lots of personality (and a very small lift!). Definitely no frills but very clean and charming. Great downtown location at edge of Red Light District but never felt concerned or uncomfortable. A lovely view of the Singel canal from our windows. A tasty breakfast was served in a quaint breakfast room. We definitely enjoyed our stay and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Brouwer is where you need to stay”
Reviews.Author: ll_Zoes_Dad_ll
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Brouwer while we were on the Amsterdam leg of our European trip this summer. It has to be said that the Brouwer experience ranked right up there with any hotel I have ever stayed at. If your looking for a North American style hotel with 250 rooms, kids running down the hallways screaming and plain drab rooms, then book somewhere else because the Brouwer is a quaint, quiet 8 room B&B style hotel. The staff - one word...amazing. From the minute we got there, the staff was friendly, courteous (we arrived at 7am and were allowed to put our luggage in the office until our room was ready), and knowledgable about the area. They served us a very nice breakfast each morning (which is included in youe stay) of various breads/cheese and eggs. The room - we stayed on the second floor faceing the canal. By European standards the room was HUGE, lol. Very nice character with wooden beams and paintings on the walls done by the artist who's name adorns the room. The bathroom was updated with modern fixtures and was kept very clean. The beds were very comfortable and had fresh linens. Some people have complained about noise coming from the canal at night, and yes we could hear people but it didn't prevent us from getting to sleep or wake us up. The location - location, location, location. Only a 5-7 minute walk from Central Station, located on the Singel canal right in the heart of the city. We never had to take a taxi while in Amsterdam. We walked everywhere, because we could. The Brouwer is located close to everything and if you really want to get out from the city centre, then take a bicycle tour ( I suggest Mike's Bike's, they were great!!). My wife and I would DEFINATELY stay here again if we ever go back to Amsterdam, the Brouwer gets great rating for good reason, it's a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brouwer - I actually miss it!”
Reviews.Author: Slangevar
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Brouwer's 55 euro/night single room (the Hals room) for four nights in August and I loved every night of it. Here are some specifics: ELEVATOR: It's tiny, but they have one! My Belgian friend was amazed by this, as most older historical hotels and even new ones) make you walk up thin, twisty stairs. ROOM: It was small, but normal by European standards. I never felt cramped. The bed was a very comfortable twin; it had a desk, a few side tables and a thin closet. It did have a phone, but no TV (which was fine). Local calls are cheap; calls to European cell phones are not - check before you call! BATHROOM: The shower is basically a third of the bathroom sectioned off by a shower curtain and a small dip in the floor, so it was a little tricky to shower without getting everything wet, but I did it. Otherwise the bathroom was very modern. VIEW: Spectacular. The room faces the intersection of two canals, which are lit up at night. NEIGHBORHOOD: The hotel is on the edge of a red light district, but I (as a single girl in my 30s) never felt at all uncomfortable or in danger. And the hotel is VERY central... I could walk to almost everything. BREAKFAST: YUUMMY, and included in the rate! Tea/coffee, juice, fresh breads, cheese, ham and an egg. When I wanted to go to the Anne Frank museum early, they even made me a little ham & cheese roll to eat in line. STAFF: Really lovely, helpful people. They told me where to rent a bike nearby, which I used my entire trip. And they shared loads of stories about previous visitors and the incredibly history of the Brouwer. Overall, the Brouwer is not a luxury hotel, but I can't believe it's only a one star. One of the staff members told me they don't actually want more stars because the hotel is so popular now, he's having to come in and reject dozens of people every day. I loved, loved, loved it and would stay here again in a heartbeat (if I can book early enough).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brouwer - An Amazing Experience, Never to Forget.”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinandAndreas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Brouwer in Jan 2007 and absolutely loved it. Let me say this first, when I travel, I always thought I wanted top notch, 5 star hotels. Hotel Brouwer far outways the 5 star hotels any day of week/month/year. It is quaint, with a fabulous location, overlooking the canal and smack bang in the middle of the red light district. This being said, I never once felt uneasy or nervous. Forget the chain hotels, this is a perfect example of the authenic experience you want when travelling. The staff are friendly, and the breakfasts were lovely, served in lovely china, in front of the fireplace. The bathroom was small, the rooms are old, and the rooms weren't serviced (we only stayed two nights though), but it didn't matter. This place is amazing and I would come back again, and again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “view of the singel”
Reviews.Author: travelinghoya
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Brouwer. We stayed in the Rembrandt room which was roomy (esp. compared to our Parisian hotel) with an understated Dutch style. We had two walls of windows that made the room very airy and bright. We loved opening the windows and looking out on the canal-- at night the heavy curtains are perfect.. The room is basic, but just what you need when most of the time will be spent walking around Amsterdam. The only complaint is something common in cities and old buildings, it was a bit noisy outside. Unlike most European breakfasts, this one is very filling. As others stated, each person gets 3 types of roll, cheeses, a freshly medium boiled egg, coffee, juice. The people are VERY friendly. We found the hotel easy going and relaxed. The stairs are narrow, but unless you go to a big hotel its going to be the deal in most hotels in the area. There are red lights on the back of the hotel, and two down the block...but really we found the area to be quaint and lovely. If you don't want to see red lights you don't have to do, but it is Amsterdam so thats part of the deal. Definitely walk from Centraal Station, its about 4 blocks on the left of the canal. Also, for vegetarians there is a GREAT place 3 blocks down called Green Planet. My meat eating husband even liked it! Over all, we will definitely stay at the Brouwer on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Brouwer”
Reviews.Author: mel_jones27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Hotel Brouwer. The people that run it were very nice, the room was clean and quaint and the bathroom was huge and spotless. I enjoyed the breakfast - a croissant, whole wheat bun and another kind of bun, fresh oj and coffee and a boiled egg. The hotel was really convenient for us because it is close to the Central Station. You can pretty much walk anywhere in Amsterdam anyway which was great. Or rent a bike or jump on one of the canal tour boats. We really loved Amsterdam, the canals, the people, everything. Anne Frank house, Van Gogh museum, canal tour. Try Walk to Wok, an asian takeout (there's 3 or 4 of them, can't miss it). Also, we found it's good to pack as light as possible when visiting Europe. Some places have narrow winding staircases and no elevators. Hotel Brouwer's staircase didn't bother us like it did some reviewers, there's only 3 levels anyway and they have a small elevator which was great for our luggage. If we go back to Amsterdam, we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Brouwer was perfect”
Reviews.Author: cherylgny
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Brouwer for a week and it was perfect. I stayed in the Van Gogh, a double on the 2nd floor. There was a great view overlooking the Singel canal. The room was clean, the beds comfortable. At 90 Euros a night including breakfast, it can't be beat. Wonderful coffee, warm croisant, rolls, etc, cheese and a boiled egg. There is a very small elevator that worked fine (used it going up) and to move the luggage. The hotel doesn't want you to use the elevator after 11PM, and the other option is very circular staircase. For those into heavy partying and staying out late, the staircase might be an issue! There was a bit of street noise but I welcomed it, being from NYC! The hotel staff was very helpful...would recommend this place to anyone who wanted a clean, no frills room in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ppoh
Reviews.Content: This was spot on for us. We were an eight people group looking for a nice long weekend in Amsterdam. Hotel Brouwer was a perfect base for us. First, the location is great: it's by Singel canal avoiding the busy noisy streets. Yes, it does have some red lights close by and by-passers may be a bit noisy during the night. We had a spacious top floor corner room (only eight rooms in the hotel) with a stunning view. The bathroom had been renovated a short while ago. The bed was comfortable and room clean. There was no TV or minibar in the room but we actually liked that. One block away there is a convenience store where you can find food and something to drink if you want. The breakfast room was small and cosy and very nice breafast was served between 8.30 and 10.30. Rolls, croissants, coffee/tea, boiled eggs, and juice. For 90â‚¬ this hotel is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further- a great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jan_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: My stay as a solo traveler for two nights was wonderful. My windows opened onto the canal (photo included) and, since they are on a corner, you actually see two canals; they are beautiful at night. The room was adequate (all rooms have toilet and shower) and breakfast was very nice with egg, warm breads, juice, and a French press of coffee- a nice touch. Yes, it's an old, creaky, noisy place but that adds to the experience actually... and it is totally non-smoking. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rates are reasonable, and the walk from the train station is no more than 10 minutes. Amsterdam is the best; if you have never been it is a must see.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Algebra
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed two nights at Hotel Brouwer and it was great. We were in the Rembrandt room (corner room on second floor). VERY clean. VERY comfortable beds (two twins). The breakfast was great and the location was perfect. No issue with coming and going through the side door, as two late 30's (early 40's) moms from NJ we felt perfectly safe at all times. Hotel Brouwer was such a find, I will be back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel With a Special Ambience”
Reviews.Author: lektor
Reviews.Content: Hotel Brouwer is high up on Tripadvisors list of the most popular hotels in Amsterdam, and having spent two nights there, I can confirm that it certainly merits this position. It's very reasonably priced, centrally located and provides the guests with a cozy ambience (gezellig is the Dutch word for it, I guess). A nice breakfast room with a large shelf of guide books and a nice lady ready to help anybody asking for advice. My single room was miniscule but adequate for a short stay. The bed was good and so was the bathroom. Some noise from the outside, but I guess that's just something one will have to accept in the center of Amsterdam. Would certainly come back to this hotel for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Keep this place a secret.....”
Reviews.Author: CharleyBrown76
Reviews.Content: I am really reluctant to praise the Brouwer too much in case it becomes too popular and somehow spoiled. I needed a room in Amsterdam at the last minute for just one night and after reading the reviews of the Brouwer on Tripadvisor and checking their web site I called them directly and booked the only room they had available - a double for 75 Euro including breakfast. My whole experience right from the booking call to the lovely relaxed breakfast before I left was excellent. This is probably as close to staying with a Dutch family in their own home as I will get. I was given the 'Mondriaan' room right up at the top of the building - great bright space that would have made a perfect artist studio. Windows onto the Singel canal which was stunning at night when lit up. I think the official rating is 1 star and the facilities strictly reflect that - no TV ( brilliant peace and quiet) and no other usual in-room extras. However the room was neat, clean and furnished almost in a Shaker style. I would love to have been able to spend some more time relaxing in it. Great to have a hotel room which lends itself to reading. The bathroom was spacious with a great 'wet shower' area and also a really good bath. One slight downside in being in the roof was that the plumbing for the building talked to me most of the night - but even with that I got a great night's sleep in a very comfortable bed. The reception area has local paintings and family memorabilia everywhere - this has been a family run place for years and has an interesting history. The dog's bed was beside my table at breakfast although he/she didn't make an appearance. The location is also perfect - a few minutes walk to Centraal Station and sandwiched between the centre of town and the Jordaan district. There are loads of good eating places all within 5 minutes walk - the owner or any of his staff are happy to point you in the right direction. I most definitely would re-visit the Brouwer - in fact I would not now stay anywhere else in Amsterdam - a real find and under Â£50 for a room for two people in the centre of Amsterdam,overlooking a grand canal in a lovely neighbourhood - what else can be said.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ArferDent
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to repeat all those reviews that have gone before. Enough to say, this is a great little place, fantastic location, good value and very helpful. We didn't see the mouse ! One slight minus point; the thin alley that runs along the side of the hotel isn't the best area, it can be a little scary is arriving back t the hotel late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay At The Brouwer”
Reviews.Author: TEHALL2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Brouwer previously (November of 2005) and simply loved it. When we got home, we immediately booked our next trip, which was for New Year's Eve 2007. When we stayed the time before, (see our other review too!) we had the Van Gogh room first, which was comfy and clean and larger than we had thought it would be, and then after we returned from a mid-trip jaunt to London, we had the Escher room, which far exceeded our expectations. The room was on the top floor with a comanding view of the Singel Canal, bathroom was huge and everything was comfy and clean...ah...just the way I like it! When I booked this time, I asked for the other room on the third floor, which is named Mondriaan. It was set up differently from the Escher room, but it was awesome too! The bathroom was also huge and as usual, totally clean and comfy. I never get tired of the view, either. In fact, we never seem to notice that there is no TV in the room. New Year's Eve in Amsterdam was something that I will never forget. There were fireworks EVERYWHERE. I was worried that we were not close enough to the action on the sleepy Singel, however the action found us! Fireworks were going off in every direction that I could look in! We were totally overwhelmed by how many there were and it lasted for hours! We had such a wonderful time and were completely exhausted when we got back to our hotel! The next morning, when we got up (late), we noticed a note on our door stating that breakfast would be held for an extra hour to accommodate us later sleepers! I have to say, I think that Amsterdam may be at the top of my favorites cities list (my husband loves it there too, but says he has yet to find his favorite city...ah the excuses we make to travel more!) I have only been to Amsterdam twice, but I find I am always looking forward to when I get to go back. As long as it is available, I will always stay at the Brouwer. They are friendly, accommodating, and provide all the basics for an outstanding stay. I give the Brouwer ***** stars!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: ade1ec
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated very centrally on the Singel canal and in my opinion was worth every penny. I only stayed for one night but the room was spacious and clean and had an excellent view of the Singel Canal. The staff were very polite and friendly and served an excellent breakfast in the morning and also very happily stored our bags for us the next day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price & brilliantly located”
Reviews.Author: BizzyLizzy1
Reviews.Content: My 4 night booking was cocked up and I did not get the room I had originally booked (the Escher Room). After they showed me a dingy room and I refused it, I was, after some rearranging, given a lovely twin/double room next to Escher called the Mondrian room. Nice sized room, and a lovely bathroom. Beds clean, comfy, as was the large bathroom which also had a shower. Linen provided. View fantastic of the canal and at night it's unbelievably pretty as the canal is lit up and refects in the water.Breakfast nice..coffee or tea, boiled egg,brown rolls, crumpets,croissants (all warmed) and cheese/ jam. After a couple of days I would have liked to have seen some ham tho! Staff nice and helpful and let us keep our luggage there the day of leaving as our flight was late. Lift was tiny but good and felt safe. 60 steps to our top floor room via a spiral staircase otherwise! Lift can't be used after 11pm. Was going to get extended 72 hour tram/bus pass but didn't in the end, as everything was so near. i just bought the 'Strippenkaarte' at a newsagents just by the side entrance, which is the way you go to get the tram. Central station is 12 mins away or a couple of tram stops.Dam square, where the Palace, department stores and Madame Tussauds is , is 1 stop away or 5 min walk. That is the starting point for good shopping N.B. Shops close every Monday morning till 1pm). From there the shopping streets extend like a spider's web! Did some good shopping! Hold your purses/wallets close to u...u never know! I never got approached over drugs, but a couple of times a tramp came up to me asking for change. Anne Frank house is only 2 tram stops away, and further down from the Anne Frank house on the same side is a not-to-be-missed pancake restaurant called 'The Pancake Bakery' (yummy). Don't forget , for a burst of old traditional Holland, visit lovely Zaannse Schanse, where the old Dutch houses, windmills (you can go up one), cheese and clog making etc is...it's only 4 TRAIN stops and a 10 min walk away ...5 Euros each; a lot cheaper than the excursions, although I think the excursion goes thru Edam too on the way back.You can get a bus to Edam yourself though. Although the hotel is not strictly in the red light district, in the close vicinity there are some red lit windows with women in, but my daughter & I weren't bothered by this and generally felt safe in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjjjjjjj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October for 3 nights and had a lovely time. Hotel is very clean and staff are friendly. It's also in a great location for exploring the city. Only downside we found was no tea or coffee facilities in the room. But the view from the window was nice and offers some quality entertainment at night

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneinParis
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hotel Brouwer in the Vermeer room in October 2006 for three nights. We highly recommend it. Here are our comments: Pluses: - Friendly people - Cute breakfast room and breakfasts -- great coffee - Elevator - Location, not far from train station, easy walk - comfortable beds and pillows - clean - feel a bit like you are "back in time" (which we liked) Minuses (if you think they are): - no TV, but then it is quieter in the building! - somewhat noisy on the street side as the windows are not soundproofed; the Vermeer room had two small windows on the back which we could open for air circulation, while leaving the front windows closed; bring some earplugs if things like this really bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely! Great location and city views.”
Reviews.Author: NickGol
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel right in the centre of things. We stayed (as many other people writing reviews here) in the Escher room on the top floor. The hotel only has 8 rooms, so booking ahead is a must. The views from the Escher room over the canal and city are great. Breakfast was simple but well prepared and really nice. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The only thing i could really critisise is the climb up to the room! If you dont fancy going in a lift the size of a shoebox (which can't be used after 11pm) you have quite a climb in front of you, up a very narrow and tight spiral staircase. Would definitely stay again (even with all those stairs to climb!)

Reviews.Title: “Superb! Loved the Escher room!”
Reviews.Author: Merbear47
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, clean, comfortable and spacious. We stayed in the Escher suite which was on the top floor. There was a small elevator. The bathroom was impeccably clean with double sinks, magnifying mirrors, a separate bathtub and a nice shower with good water pressure. It was a handheld, but you could keep it on the wall if you wanted. The only poor thing to say was when you had a shower the water went all over the floor and flooded the bathroom, but this seemed to happen a lot in Europe hotel bathrooms. The breakfast was amazing. We had a choice of coffee or tea. There was fresh warm baked rolls, crumpets and croissants..yummy. They served Old Amsterdam cheese, boiled eggs and jam. The cheese was delicious as was everything else. The hotel was on a main canal - the Singel canal, maybe a 10 minute walk from the main train station. The beds were comfortable with down comforters and and the room was very spacious with a comfy couch, a coat rack, a clothes wardrobe and the beautiful bathroom. Great, great hotel! Service was wonderful too, with very friendly staff, who even let us keep our bags there on our last day while we sightsaw some more.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel in Ams”
Reviews.Author: Travels_too_muchUtah
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for the Brouwer. From the tasty breakfast (suprisingly good croissants and terrific coffee!) to the spectacular views, this hotel is the best deal in Amsterdam. We were in the Van Gogh room, which is a corner room with views on two sides. I fell in love with the views, and the location. We were central to everything. Yes, you are in a red light district, but that's easily ignorable, and you are just a couple of blocks from the main shopping area where you can find anything you might need. This is so much better than those big chains around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “How I miss the Brouwer!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely nothing bad to say about Amsterdam's delightful Hotel Brouwer. For starters, its location is ideal - a gorgeous, five-minute walk to Centraal Station, and close to countless cafes (also a few Red Light windows, if you're interested in that). I stayed in the Mesdag Room for four nights - at 55 Euros a night, it seemed like a steal. The room was tiny, but it had everything - a comfortable bed, a phone, working shower, secure locks (not that you'll need it here), and a view. The staff members at the hotel are very friendly and told me some of Amsterdam's history when I asked. Breakfast is served promptly. There isn't much variety but it's still filling, and there are many other cafes in the area to choose from if you'd like a change. Be prepared for a steep climb up the hotel's staircase if you come in late at night. I really don't think there would be a better hotel to stay at in all of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Best 400 year old Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: p1997
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brouwer was so cool! It was built in 1652 and I don't think much has been done in the bedrooms since - other than adding the bathrooms. The rooms are very simply furnished, but every minute that we were not actually out seeing Amsterdam, we were at our windows watching Amsterdam. The location on the scenic Singel canal can't be beat and nearly everything is within walking distance. Breakfast in the morning was simple, but delicious, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Two warnings, however: There is a small elevator, big enough for 2 people. But it can't be used after 11:00pm and if you're handicapped, like me, you need to be aware that there are about 5 steps to get up to the lift. In all of my emails to the hotel about the handicapped business, he never mentioned those first 5 steps. The second warning is that, even though you have to secure your reservation with a credit card, they don't actually take credit cards, so be sure you've got the cash to pay at check out. But those are trifles to be overlooked - we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & Great price”
Reviews.Author: Sierrachip
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Amsterdam and had a great stay here. I booked a single room for 50 euros with shower & bath in room. The hotel also has a lift......great for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sashacharlie
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights over new year in this hotel. I cannot stress how fantastic it was. Our room was the Escher, it had so much character! The beds were very comfy though they are two singles pushed together, there is also a little seating area and a very big bathroom with separate shower and bath and two basins. The views were amazing - especially as there was so much snow while we were there. The heating worked very well - thankfully! The only grumble I had was having to walk up to the top floor after 11pm as they would rather you didn't use the lift after this time - but this was me being lazy and probably the worse for wear! Breakfast does get abit monotonous - but filling and generous nevertheless. All in all this hotel beats all the others as I feel you really do get a true taste of what Amsterdam is all about without paying a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: hitdogny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Brouwer for 8 nights at the end of October. There were 3 of us and we had a double room and a single room. We have no complaints at all. I am very happy I chose this hotel over a big chain hotel. The staff that we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast does get a little redundant(soft boiled egg, rolls and cheese) but its still good and gets you some fuel to start your day. The location was very convienent, about a 10 minute walk to Central Station and right on Singel Canal. I stayed in the Mondrian room and it was great. Terrific view, very roomy, high ceilings, and a large bathroom. The Hals room which is a single was much smaller but more than adequate. You can come and go as you please, as you are given a key to the door to use, they lock up later in the evening. The street noise was loud on occasion but nothing that ruined a nights sleep. The only problem was the stairs. There is a tiny lift that fits maybe 2 people. When we checked in we actually sent our luggage up via the lift and walked up the stairs to meet our luggage. It a narrow spiral staircase and if you are on the 3rd floor it can get to be a bit much if you make the trip several times a day. But it's a small inconvienence compared to everything else. I would definitely stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Old Amsterdam in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Brouwer for a long weekend and was charmed. I've stayed in A'dam many times but only learned of this place. It is a GREAT value for the money, but don't expect business-class level services. That is not what this place is about. The Hotel Brouwer is about settling back and not rushing. The breakfast doesn't start until 8:30 and is delicious. The coffee, bread basket, eggs and cheese were very tasty and filling. While there is no TV (unless you ask for one but why?), limited phone service, and modest toiletries, the rooms are a good size, the bathrooms are good size and there was a lot of hot water for the shower or tub. The views over the Singel canal are much better than watching TV and you get a friendly family atmosphere that is a throw back 15 years. The non-smoking policy and friendly staff makes it very family friendly. The only warning is that if you come in after 11pm, you are asked not to use the elevator -- this could be difficult if your room is on the top floor unless you are in decent shape. All in all, this place is a winner and I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all and the mouse exists.”
Reviews.Author: Hawker
Reviews.Content: This hotel has amazing reviews on this website so I was really looking forward to staying here. I have backpacked around Europe twice now and have stayed in many 1 to 2 star places of similar price. I can only say that this is the second worse place I have ever stayed in (the worst was a half star in florence). As we walked into the room all I could see was a swarm of flies and other assorted insects. They just kept flying around the room. Everytime I came in I killed off most of them but they just kept coming back for the whole three days. There were copious marks on the roof from other people trying to kill these insects. Don't stay here in summer either. It was hot. No fan. I'm from Queensland in Australia so I'm used to the heat and it was still hot. The mouse does exist. We left early in the morning and you have to walk through the kichen to drop your keys off. A mouse scurried over the bench where breakfast is prepared. Disgusting. Also no TV and no TV room. You are there to experience Amsterdam but it's just nice to watch a little TV before bed. Your on holidays. The only good things about this place are the price and location, but surely for an extra couple of dollars its worth staying somewhere else. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lalli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Brouwer on our honeymoon in May 2005. The room we had was double aspect and very roomy. Although we had a shock when we arrived as the downstairs seemed so shabby. Also, its no good going there if you have walking difficulties as the only way upstairs is either by the spiral staircase or a rickety old lift which only holds one person. Having said all that, the bedrooms were lovely and clean and the beds were quite comfortable, although it was very cold. The breakfasts could have done with some variation as it was just eggs eggs and more eggs. The owners were a little dour as well, but apart from that, it was very authentic and very cheap. We would definitely stay there again. PS Not a sign of a mouse anywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: evolution
Reviews.Content: For once a hotel that looks as good as it does on their website! We stayed at The Hotel Brouwer on 24th and 25th of July (Fri & Sat) and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I have never visited Amsterdam before but my UK based brother and his fiancee had (4 times) and they believe it to be the best value and best quality hotel they'd visited. Considering they'd stayed at hotels up to twice the price (and none cheaper) they really thought it was great find and one that they will return to. The rooms were clean and comfortable with and authentic Amsterdam charm in a building that is 350 odd years old. You are situated right on one of the inner canals (Singel) with a short walk to the central train station, dam square, the red light district, the park, markets, coffeeshops, pubs, food, anne frank, bike hire etc. Breakfast was served consisting of fresh crumpets, multi-grain roll, crossant eggs, coffee and orange juice and was a great start to the day. We will definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone who wants a good honest value for money hotel with the personal touches from an ower who really cares about the guests. Budget conscious travellers will find this one hard to beat. The location is nice and quiet but close enough to the hot spots that you are not left out of anything. You even get a beautiful view of the canal from your room. Trip tip - hire bikes and cycle around amsterdam - especially, check out the little butcher shop below the hotel - he served hot pork sausage that was simply awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Brouwer for three nights in mid-June 2005. The weather was unusually hot (in the mid-80s) but our top floor room - The Escher, was very comfortable. It is a corner room and with the windows open, gets a good breeze. Street noise was not a problem, maybe because we were so high up or maybe because I've heard one too many rock concerts! The tiny (and I mean tiny) elevator is a big plus though the stairs are not as bad as most restored canal houses. Room was spacious and had a very generous private bathroom. Room is a double (by pushing two twin beds together) and they kept separating, especially during heavy exercising ;) Towel allotment is a bit stingy but not a problem. Owners were very gracious and the breakfast was adequate (good semi-hard boiled egg, cheese, coffee, juice and a good assortment of bread). And the location - in a word - Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Greensleeves
Reviews.Content: I was almost tempted not to write this review, as this hotel is becoming so popular it is necessary to book well ahead. We spent 5 nights there during the Queens Day holiday and it is the best value we have ever had. Friendly, immaculately clean, very atmospheric and placed ideally for most of the attractions, especially the Jordaan area. Excellent breakfast, served at our table with warm rolls and a freshly boiled egg. we will always try and book this when we go to Amsterdam. Incidentally, prices the same for this week-end which is a major Dutch holday ,as the rest of the year. Other hotels please note !

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a find! Three generations of our family spent 6 nights here and all agreed it was perfect. Only 8 rooms on the Singel Canal it was clean, quiet, and restful. Each room is en suite. A tiny elevator took those of us with creaky knees to our floors, breakfast was huge and delicious. We were welcome to check our email daily, they even provided a laundromat for guests. Fluffy comforters on our cozy beds were splendid. The tram stop is 3 minutes away, you can walk to the train station, there were many small restuarants serving fabulous meals all around the hotel. A fabulous find. Singles 50 Euros, doubles 85 euros. Book early, it is always full.

Reviews.Title: “It's as good as they say - just book well in advance!”
Reviews.Author: lauraloo
Reviews.Content: Very central (close to the station) and excellent value for money. Has real Dutch character to it with sloping floors, tiny antiquated lift (which you feel scared to get into) and tiled breakfast room. But as people are spreading the word it is getting booked up months in advance so get in there quick - this is not a last minute deal place! I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a fantastic location. Cosy, warm, pleasant rooms, friendly staff, comfortable beds and not expensive. Breakfast was good and hearty, although a little repetitive (there's only so many boiled eggs you can eat without tiring of them!). Most rooms have a great view of the canals below, a good spot for just watching Amsterdam go by. A very central location less than 10 minutes walk from Centraal and a tram stop less than a hundred yards away. Also convenient for The Pancake Bakery and Anne Frank. Unless you're after a luxurious stop-over, this should suit most people fine. I read the 'mousey' review and I have to say we didn't see any evidence of mice - hopefully this was just a one-off. One final thing though - the reviewer who didn't see any red lights didn't look too hard, because there was one less than 5 doors away !

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Brouwer
HotelInfo.Address: Singel 83, Amsterdam 1012 VE, The Netherlands
